title: Machine Learning Engineer, Performance
description:
Remerge helps leading mobile app marketers increase revenue and retention by activating, re-engaging and retaining high-value users through programmatic in-app ads. Founded in 2014, Remerge has established itself as a leading app retargeting player globally, with offices spanning Berlin, New York, Singapore, Seoul and Tokyo. Our international team of experts has contributed to the growth of hundreds of apps across all major verticals, including gaming, on-demand delivery, e-commerce, and finance.

Job mission

We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join our team and work on real time bidding systems which make over a billion bids a day. Your team's mission is to model user behaviour, value of the bid, price of the bid and eventually the attribution. Our goal is to automate the advertising strategy, to reach the targets for our clients as a enterprise solution.

About The Team

Our team consists of Machine Learning and Data Science experts from diverse backgrounds and are looking for an additional member for our team with experience in mixed data predictive modelling. In our day-to-day we collaborate with development as well as business teams to build a good bidding system. Joining this team you can expect colleagues that are curious about new models, analytical techniques, different architectures and more, and appreciate spending time together sparring on these ideas.

Job responsibilities


Develop and deploy complex machine learning models in Python and Tensorflow.
Ability to plan and manage different stages of model development (research, development, metrics, real world experiments, deployment)
Be the person of contact for business teams in a region, on client issue and provide solutions / explanations on system behaviour
Be the second line of contact on the models, during on-call alerts.


Job requirements


2-3 years experience working in programatic advertising (DSP, SSP, Ad exchange). Work in retargeting campaigns is a plus.
A good foundation in mathematics of neural networks, loss functions, metrics to analyse performance.
Familiar with Machine learning infrastructure , building models for continuous deployment .
Expertise in building multi modal machine learning models is a plus.
Expertise in dealing with mixed data, models on large data (> 1B records), embedding layers.
Good software engineering skills.
Good communication skills, explaining model behaviour to business teams.


Our promise


Unlimited vacation days - for real. We give you the freedom to figure out the most productive work-life balance for you
Mentorship program for technical and non-technical skills
A truly modern place to work: work from home, from our brand new office in Berlin - your work environment is yours to design. We also offer flexibility in remote work.
Generous remuneration package including virtual shares, a dedicated education budget
End of the year bonus determined by company performance
Travel to our offices around the globe for a short term assignment for up to a month every two years
Comfortable work setup - laptop, phone, screen(s), standing desk etc.
Support for your setup while working from home
Wellness benefits such as sports memberships, Nilo Health subscription and internet reimbursements
Company events including breakfast twice a week, team lunches, birthday and milestone celebrations, quarterly team events and company-wide parties & trips


Remerge is an Equal Opportunity Employer: all qualified applicants are considered for positions regardless of race, ethnic origin, gender, age, religion or belief, marital status, gender identification, sexual orientation, veteran status or disability. We're looking forward to your application!

Important notice: Protect yourself from scammers representing Remerge

Do not respond to job offers from third parties claiming to recruit on behalf of Remerge, or individuals impersonating as Remerge employees offering freelance or remote work opportunities. We do not ask job applicants for personal information like bank account numbers, address, money transfer requests, or other confidential details on any messaging platform. If someone reaches out to you to offer you a job, make sure that they are a verified Remerge employee by checking their identity on official Remerge channels.

Please note that the only job openings we offer are listed on our official website: remerge.io/careers

Stay vigilant and protect yourself from potential scams.

Please review our Applicants Privacy Policy.
Show more

title: ML Engineer (Computer Vision)
description:
Dein Impact

We're seeking an exceptional Machine Learning Engineer with expertise in computer vision to join our growing team. You will be our first ML Engineer, set up our entire ML infrastructure and play a critical role in developing innovative solutions to streamline heat pump installations.


Develop and implement machine learning models. The core will be a computer vision model based on camera and LiDAR data.
Design, build, and maintain the ML infrastructure
Preprocess and analyze large datasets
Train and fine-tune machine learning models
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions into the platform
Monitor and improve the performance of deployed models


Wen wir suchen


Strong proficiency in machine learning and computer vision techniques
Experience with ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar
Proficiency in Python and related ML libraries
Familiarity with LiDAR technology and data processing
Experience in setting up and managing ML infrastructure
Preferably based in Berlin, with a willingness to work from our office close to Rosenthaler Platz


Was wir bieten


Office in Berlin-Mitte: Our office is located near Weinbergspark in Berlin-Mitte.
Equipment: You have the freedom to choose your own equipment (within a budget range).
Annual Team Retreat: Let’s enjoy an annual retreat with the entire team.
Mobility Package: Choose between a JobRad and Dance Bike for your mobility.
Fitness Package: Choose between Urban Sports and Classpass for your fitness.
Collegial and Familial Team: A collegial and familial team welcomes you, characterized by an open company culture.
Part of the Energy Transition: Be a part of the energy transition and directly experience the impact of your daily work.


Nächste Schritte


Screening Call: A brief initial conversation to discuss your background and the role.
First Interview: A deeper dive into your experience, skills, and fit for the role.
Coding Challenge: A technical assessment to evaluate your coding skills and problem-solving abilities.
Final Interview: A comprehensive interview with key team members, focusing on technical expertise, cultural fit, and your vision for the role.


Über uns

Mit autarc entwickeln wir das führende Betriebssystem (OS) für Wärmepumpen-Installateure. Wusstest Du, dass 25% der CO2-Emissionen in Europa durch das Heizen unserer Gebäude verursacht werden? Das Problem: Es gibt zu wenige Installateure, um den wachsenden Bedarf an Wärmepumpen zu decken. Deshalb haben wir es uns zur Aufgabe gemacht, die Abwicklung von Wärmepumpen-Projekten für Handwerker deutlich digitaler, effizienter und einfacher zu gestalten. Mit autarc verringern wir gezielt die Hürden, um Einfamilienhäuser und kleine Mehrfamilienhäuser in Europa zu dekarbonisieren. Wir unterstützen Installateure dabei, sicher und problemlos auf Wärmepumpen umzusteigen.

title: Junior Data Scientist AI Academy
description:
Über uns

statworx ist ein führendes Beratungs- und Entwicklungsunternehmen für Daten und KI mit Sitz in Frankfurt am Main. Wir bieten strategische Beratung für mittelständische Unternehmen und globale Konzerne. Wir entwickeln innovative Daten- & KI-Lösungen für alle Unternehmensbereiche und Tätigkeitsfelder. Wir befähigen Menschen auf allen Kompetenzniveaus mit unseren Daten- & KI-Bildungsformaten. Kurz gesagt: Wir unterstützen Unternehmen bei allen Aspekten der digitalen Transformation – seit mehr als 10 Jahren, in über 500 Daten- & KI-Projekten und für über 100 Kunden aus fast allen Industrien.

Seit 2011 haben wir in unserer statworx AI Academy weltweit bereits über 15.000 Personen in den Themengebieten Data Science, künstliche Intelligenz und Machine Learning weitergebildet. Von kleinen Trainingseinheiten & Einstiegsprogrammen bis zu langfristigen und globalen Schulungskonzepten und Data Culture Initiativen für unsere Kunden im DAX-Umfeld, bieten wir ein vielfältiges und maßgeschneidertes Portfolio an. Unser Anspruch ist es, stetig am Puls der Zeit zu sein (aktuell u.A. Generative KI, Large Language Models und Data Culture) und unsere Trainingsmethoden konstant weiterzuentwickeln. Zum weiteren Aufbau unseres Teams und Schulungsangebotes suchen wir derzeit nach Verstärkung.

Deine Aufgaben


Du unterstützt uns bei der Beratung unserer (potenziellen) Kunden aus verschiedenen Industrien hinsichtlich des Einsatzes von Trainings zur Fortbildung ihrer Mitarbeitenden in den Themenfeldern Daten, Machine Learning, AI und Cloud
Du wirkst bei der Entwicklung und Durchführung von spannenden AI Workshops für verschiedene Zielgruppen (Projektmanager:innen und Expert:innen) mit
Du unterstützt bei der Entwicklung von neuen Trainingskonzepten und -inhalten und konzipierst interaktive Aufgaben u.a. für Themenbereiche wie künstliche Intelligenz, Generative KI, Data Science, Machine Learning, Cloud, Business Intelligence und Coding
Du sondierst den Markt für AI und Cloud-Trainings und unterstützt uns dabei, vielversprechende Zukunftsfelder zu identifizieren und so unseren Mitbewerber:innen stets einen Schritt voraus zu sein


Dein Profil


Du hast Dein Masterstudium im Bereich Data Science, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Mathematik, Statistik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften, o.ä. erfolgreich abgeschlossen
Im Rahmen Deines Studiums und/oder studentischer Tätigkeiten konntest Du bereits erste theoretische und idealerweise auch praktische Erfahrungen in den Bereichen Statistik, Data Science, Machine Learning, Cloud oder AI sammeln
Weiterhin verfügst Du über gute Kenntnisse in der Programmiersprache Python
Du begeisterst dich sehr für die Themenfelder Digitalisierung, Big Data und AI und hast Freude daran, diese Begeisterung mit anderen zu teilen
Du zeigst herausragende konzeptionelle und analytische Fähigkeiten
Dir macht es Spaß, komplexe Sachverhalte strukturiert grafisch und verbal aufzubereiten und an andere Personen zu vermitteln
Du bist kommunikationsstark, verfügst über sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse (mindestens C1, in Wort und Schrift) und fühlst dich wohl, Schulungen in beiden Sprachen zu halten
Du hast Freude daran, gelegentlich Reisen zu unseren Kunden im europäischen Raum zu unternehmen


Das bieten wir Dir


Die Möglichkeit, die Weiterentwicklung unseres Schulungsportfolios aktiv mitzugestalten und mit innovativen Methoden dazu beizutragen, anspruchsvolle und komplexe Themen wie AI und Data Science verständlich und erlebbar zu machen 
Umfassende eigene methodische und persönliche Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten inklusive regelmäßiger interner Schulungsangebote sowie eines individuellen Weiterbildungsbudgets
Kreative Zusammenarbeit und kurze Entscheidungswege und -prozesse, gepaart mit einer agilen Arbeitsweise  
Flache, teambasierte Hierarchien und ein freundschaftliches Arbeitsklima
Kurze Entscheidungswege und -prozesse, gepaart mit einer agilen Arbeitsweise und regelmäßigem Feedback
Ein offenes, integratives, chancengleiches Arbeitsumfeld
Faires Gehalt: es erwarten dich transparente Gehaltsstufen, welche wir regelmäßig an Marktentwicklungen anpassen
Eine Arbeitswoche nach dem 4:1-Modell, bei dem wir uns an 4 Tagen pro Woche auf unsere Kerntätigkeiten konzentrieren und 1 Tag pro Woche für unsere individuelle und organisatorische Weiterentwicklung verwenden (z. B. durch Schulungen, teamübergreifende Arbeitsgruppen) 
Ein modernes, hochwertig eingerichtetes Office das zum Austauschen und Verweilen einlädt, sowie die Möglichkeit flexibel auch von anderen Orten zu arbeiten, darunter auch bis zu 6 Wochen aus dem EU-Ausland
Stark ermäßigtes Jobticket Deutschland sowie kostengünstig Zugang zu einer Vielzahl von Sport- und Wellnessangeboten (Wellpass)
Und viele weitere Benefits, wie z. B. Apple IT-Equipment (MacBook Pro), regelmäßige Team-Events, Employee Discounts, Kinderbetreuungsunterstützung, kostenfreie Getränke und Snacks


Deine Bewerbung

Bewirb Dich einfach über das Bewerbungsformular und hänge Deinen aktuellen Lebenslauf an. Wir werden uns anschließend umgehend bei Dir melden. Bei Fragen rund um Deine Bewerbung oder die verschiedenen Einstiegsmöglichkeiten erreichst Du uns telefonisch unter +49-(0)69-6783-0676-5 oder unter jobs@statworx.com.

Was für uns besonders wichtig ist: Wir schätzen die Einzigartigkeit jedes Menschen und begegnen einander stets auf Augenhöhe. Unterschiedliche Hintergründe, Einstellungen und Ideen bereichern uns und bilden die Grundlage unseres Erfolgs. Daher freuen wir uns über jede Bewerbung – unabhängig von Geschlecht, Nationalität, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion, Weltanschauung, Behinderung, Alter sowie sexueller Orientierung und Identität.

title: Computer Vision Engineer
description:
Computer Vision Engineer - LLM

Experience: 2 - 15 Years

Location- Permanent Remote Anywhere in the world

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, 5 hours Mandatory overlap with PST

Total Years Of exp- 2+ years Mandatory

Mandatory Skills- Python: min 2yrs, Python for Data Science: min1 yr, Computer Vision: min1 yr, PyTorch: min 1 yr, OpenCV: min 1 yr, Tensorflow: min 1 yr, Image Recognition: min 1 yr

Key Skills: Computer Vision, Python, Pytorch, OpenCV, Image Recognition

Job Responsibilities


Develop and maintain machine learning models, with a focus on computer vision algorithms.
Implement image processing techniques such as object detection, segmentation, and image classification using Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs).
Work with TensorFlow or PyTorch to develop, train, and deploy vision models.
Utilize OpenCV for tasks like feature extraction, image filtering, and object tracking.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance AI-driven solutions in the mobile coding domain.


﻿

Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
At least 2+ years of experience as a Python-focused Engineer.
Expertise in image processing and computer vision algorithms using CNNs.
Strong experience with TensorFlow/PyTorch for developing, training, and deploying vision models.
Proficiency in OpenCV for image processing tasks.


Nice To Have


Experience with Keras for quick prototyping of deep learning models.
Familiarity with Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications in AI.
Knowledge of cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.


Skills: large language models (llms),tensorflow or pytorch,google cloud,image filtering,segmentation,opencv,python for data science,feature extraction,processing,cross-functional collaboration,algorithms,mobile coding domain,cloud platforms (aws, azure, google cloud),object tracking,cnns,computer science,cloud platforms,image processing,tensorflow/pytorch,deep learning,pytorch,mobile coding,convolutional neural networks (cnns),aws,azure,models,convolutional neural networks,tensorflow,ai-driven solutions,machine learning,engineering,keras,python,llms,image recognition,deep learning models,computer vision,object detection

title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer (w/m/d)
description:
DARAUF KÖNNEN SIE SICH FREUEN


Sie verantworten das Design, die Entwicklung und Implementierung von Machine-Learning- und Deep-Learning-Modellen zur Lösung komplexer Probleme
Sie übernehmen die Analyse großer Datensätze sowie die Datenaufbereitung und -bereinigung um hochwertige Eingabedaten für Modelle zu gewährleisten
Sie wirken an der Erstellung von Prototypen und Proofs of Concept für AI-Lösungen mit
Sie optimieren Modelle hinsichtlich Leistung und Effizienz
Sie arbeiten eng zusammen mit Data Scientists, Softwareentwickelnden und Produktmanagern, um AI-Lösungen in Produkte zu integrieren
Sie verfolgen die neuesten Entwicklungen und Trends im Bereich der künstlichen Intelligenz



DAS MACHT SIE AUS


Sie verfügen über eine abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Informatik, Mathematik, Data Science oder einer verwandten Disziplin
Sie verfügen über mehrere Jahre Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Implementierung von AI- und ML-Modellen
Sie verfügen über fundierte Kenntnisse in den Bereichen Machine Learning, Deep Learning, statistische Modellierung und Algorithmen
Sie haben Erfahrung mit Programmiersprachen wie Python, R oder Java sowie Frameworks wie TensorFlow, PyTorch oder Keras
Sie haben tiefgreifende technische Kenntnisse mit Datenbankmanagement und -abfragen, insbesondere mit SQL und NoSQL-Datenbanken
Sie verfügen über starke analytische und Problemlösungsfähigkeiten, einen ausgeprägtem agilen Mindset und sind mit der Anwendung von Tools im Rahmen der agilen Softwareentwicklung vertraut
Ihnen ist die Arbeit mit internationalen Teams vertraut

title: Artificial Intelligence Consultant
description:
Job Opportunity: Consultant in Artificial Intelligence (All Genders)




About the Company:




Join a leading IT firm dedicated to enhancing core business processes through customised IT solutions. By leveraging cutting-edge technology, they drive customer success and innovation. The company's greatest asset is their diverse and talented team, which combines creativity, technical expertise, and the latest technologies to shape the future of AI and data science.




Role Overview:




Are you passionate about Artificial Intelligence and Data Science? We invite you to join our client’s dynamic Data Science and AI team, where you will play a pivotal role in advising clients on AI strategies and implementing innovative AI solutions. Your expertise will help shape the future of their clients' businesses.




Key Responsibilities:




AI Strategy Consulting: Advise clients on comprehensive AI strategies tailored to their business needs.
Project Leadership: Lead and manage AI projects to ensure client success and satisfaction.
Use Case Identification: Identify and define impactful AI use cases to drive business value.
Solution Development: Design, develop, and implement state-of-the-art AI solutions.
Infrastructure Design: Architect AI infrastructures leveraging big data and cloud technologies.




Key Requirements:




Educational Background: Degree or PhD in (business) informatics, mathematics, physics, economics, or a related field.
AI Expertise: Proven experience in AI architecture and solution design.
Technical Proficiency: Skilled in designing and training AI modules.
Communication Skills: Excellent ability to communicate effectively with teams and stakeholders.
Project Management: Experience in agile project management and team leadership is a plus.
AI Governance: Knowledge of AI governance and trustworthy AI practices is highly beneficial.




Why Join them?




Inclusive Environment: Thrive in a collegial, inclusive, and respectful workplace that values diversity and teamwork.
Professional Growth: Opportunities for continuous learning and development in a cutting-edge field.
Innovative Culture: Be part of a team that is at the forefront of technological innovation and AI advancements.
Impactful Work: Contribute to projects that have a meaningful impact on their clients' businesses and the broader community.




If you are ready to take on a challenging and rewarding role in AI consulting, we want to hear from you. Join them and be part of a team that is shaping the future of technology and business.

title: Data Scientist - Mobile Games
description:
Carry1st is Africa's leading publisher of mobile games and digital content. Operating at the intersection of games, publishing, and fintech, we scale awesome content in frontier markets by solving hard problems. Across our publishing and Pay1st business lines, we are partnered with top global game companies like Riot Games, Activision, and Stillfront. We are backed by top investors like: a16z, Bitkraft, Google, Konvoy, Riot Games, Sony and Nas.

As Sr Data Scientist, you will be responsible for driving enjoyable player experiences and sustainable player LTV. You will translate in-game behavioural data, progression trends, and purchase propensities into segmentations and models for LiveOps personalisation and UA optimisation.

You will be involved in simulating game engagement and game economy - supporting our Product teams in driving game evolution to success. As a senior member of our Data org, you will work closely with our VP Data in scaling data science as our titles multiply.

You will ...


Develop core segmentations - LTV, Behavioural - and core predictive models - LTV, Churn, IAP Propensity - to understand player profiles and behaviour
Use the above segmentations and models to develop processes and feedback loops to personalise/optimise LiveOps and UA
Identify opportunities where ML can further automate Growth & Product processes
Explore agent-based modelling and reinforcement learning to simulate gameplay and economy to drive feature and monetisation development
Partner with Product stakeholders and take the technical lead in designing experiments that explore different scenarios and key dependencies
Bank player and game insights to drive Carry1st's strategic direction via new business models



Requirements

What makes you a great candidate?


Degree in Economics, Physics, Statistics, Engineering or similar
Minimum 3 years experience in data science in an operational environment
Strong mathematical and statistical acumen
Solid SQL skills and practical analytics/data science experience with Python
Strong analytical and problems solving skills as a foundation for adaptability in an ambiguous and agile environment of diverse backgrounds
Ability to effectively communicate complex insights and hypotheses to business stakeholders



Benefits

What will it be like to work at Carry1st?

Carry1st is a fast-growing, dynamic place to work. And while we are laser focused on building the flagship mobile internet company in Africa, our team is fully remote and 100% global - with people in 25+ countries! At Carry1st, you will...


Build awesome, industry-changing products, every day
Grow with a VC-backed startup at the intersection of gaming, fintech, and web3
Work from anywhere in the world with international teammates
Own shares in the Company - enabling you to benefit from the value you create



Some Additional Perks...


Co-working excursions: Travel to meet your colleagues in cities around the world
Awesome equipment: Get everything you need to work effectively
Remote working allowance: Put an additional $600 / year to optimise your WFH experience
Learning and development: Attend courses, conferences and training events
Social events: Participate in regular company events to relax and connect with teammates
Birthday leave: Enjoy a paid day off on your special day


We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. Join us!

Learn More About Carry1st...


Andreessen Horowitz shared why they invested in Carry1st
VentureBeat announced that Carry1st has raised $27 million to develop and publish mobile games in Africa
Remerge hosted Cordel on a podcast to discuss Carry1st and the African gaming market
Show more

title: Data Scientist
description:
The ideal candidate's favorite words are learning, data, scale, and agility. You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers.

Responsibilities

Analyze raw data: assessing quality, cleansing, structuring for downstream processing
Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms
Collaborate with engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to production
Generate actionable insights for business improvements




Qualifications




Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in quantative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
At least 1 - 2 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or data modeling
Deep understanding of predictive modeling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms
Fluency in a programming language (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL)
Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools (Cassandra, Hadoop, Spark, Tableau)

title: AI Engineer
description:
Welcome to Rhesis AI, where we're passionate about making AI responsible. Our goal is to empower organizations with the right tools to navigate the complexities of AI and ensure their AI applications meet the highest standards of robustness, reliability and compliance. For this, we are developing a Continous Automated Assurance Solution.

To achieve our mission in which AI serves humanity responsibly, we need you!

Tasks

What you will do:


Oversee and/or execute the design, development, fine-tuning, and deployment of large language models and generative AI systems for the Rhesis AI platform.
Implement MLOps/LLMOps best practices to streamline the machine learning lifecycle from data ingestion to model deployment and continuous improvement.
Drive research and development to replicate state-of-the-art ML models and papers, as well as carry out independent research efforts (yes, you can publish!).
Architect and optimize near-real-time and real-time data pipelines for efficient data processing.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI solutions into existing systems and processes.
Stay updated on the latest advancements in AI, ML, and NLP to inform strategic decision-making and product innovation.
Lead research efforts to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and ethical standards in AI development and deployment.



Requirements

You are great for this role, if you have:

Important Skills


Hands-on experience with Large Language Models and Generative AI
Strong background in Python programming, ML frameworks (JAX, PyTorch, TensorFlow, HuggingFace Transformers, Scikit-Learn), and MLOps expertise.
Knowledge of ML fundamentals and software engineering best practices, such as testing.
Experience in the development of robust, production-ready code.
Proficiency in CI/CD, DevOps pipelines, and containerization.
Experience in Natural Language Processing.



Awesome Skills


Experience with research, development and/or replication of state-of-the-art ML models / papers
Experience with infrastructure automation (e.g., Infrastructure as Code).
Building near-real-time and real-time data pipelines (e.g. using Spark and/or Databricks)
Knowledge of cloud-native solutions (GCP, Azure, AWS)
Building and fine-tuning deep learning models for deployment and inference



Overall Skills


Solid software engineering skills with the ability to design sophisticated software systems, curate datasets, and train models for scientific applications.
Proficiency in Python programming and developing production-ready code for data-driven applications.
Expertise in system design and problem-solving, including the ability to decompose complex problems into simpler solutions.
Familiarity with modern development practices and tools such as version control, CI/CD, containerization, and cloud-native solutions (e.g., Azure or AWS).
Experience in building real-time data pipelines, natural language processing, container-based development, and infrastructure automation.
Previous roles as a Senior Machine Learning Engineer with MLOps experience, optimizing and deploying deep learning models.



In summary, the candidate should have a strong background in both machine learning and software engineering, with specific expertise in developing and deploying advanced machine learning models, along with a solid understanding of modern development practices and tools.

Benefits

As part of our commitment to supporting our team members, we offer a range of benefits to applicants, including:


Comprehensive compensation package including shares: We offer salaries and benefits tailored to your experience and qualifications, along with the opportunity to gain ownership in the company.
Professional development opportunities: We offer resources and support for ongoing learning and career growth, including access to training programs, workshops, and conferences.
Flexible work arrangements: We understand the importance of work-life balance and offer flexible working arrangements to accommodate personal needs and preferences.
Social and community engagement: We encourage our employees to get involved in social and community initiatives.
A supportive and collaborative work environment: We foster a culture of teamwork, collaboration, and mutual respect, where every team member is valued and supported in their professional and personal growth.



We welcome applicants from all backgrounds, irrespective of gender, nationality, religion, or any other personal characteristic. Our organization values diversity and inclusion, and we encourage individuals from all walks of life to apply for this position. Even if you believe you may not meet all the listed requirements, we encourage you to submit your application. We believe that diverse perspectives enrich our team and contribute to our collective success. Your unique skills, experiences, and perspectives are highly valued, and we look forward to considering your application.
Show more

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Generative AI (f/m/d)*
description:
YOUR MISSION

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer (f/m/d)*, you will work on Parloa’s machine learning operations platform and models as well as related software components that power our generative AI and NLU products. You will become a member of Parloa’s AI & Data Science Team that owns our ML operations platform as well as machine learning models and frameworks that power our product. You will work closely with product teams to help them solve customer problems with machine learning and AI. You will leverage cutting edge technologies to keep sharpening Parloa’s competitive edge to transform the entire customer service industry with AI.

In This Role You Will


Take ownership of data science and machine learning projects that help us improve our generative AI product suite
Work closely with product management, design and product engineers to shape requirements and our product vision leveraging AI and LLMs in line with customer needs
Execute machine learning projects end-to-end: understanding user-facing requirements, data gathering and transformation, exploratory data analysis, model productionization, maintenance and support, continuous improvement
Shape our ML platform (ML / LLM Ops) by defining the requirements and/or designing and implementing parts of it in collaboration with our data platform and DevOps teams


Our Tech stack (Data): Microsoft Azure, Python, Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform, MongoDB, Redis (more technologies will added as we build our data and Machine Learning platforms)

What You Bring To The Table


7+ years of experience as a machine learning engineer
Experience working with NLP, LLMs and information retrieval; experience with LLMs in a production environment is a strong plus
Strong proficiency in Python, proficiency with SQL
Experience working with big data technologies (e.g. Spark) and using ML Ops platforms (e.g. MLFlow)
Experience with owning the ML process end-to-end: translating product requirements into technical requirements, data gathering/transformation and exploration, model productionization, maintenance, monitoring and optimization
Experience in leading medium-sized technical projects (3-9 months roadmap)
Strong spoken and written communication skills in English


WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?


Be part of a dynamic, driven team of +20 nationalities with flat hierarchies and collaborative company culture.
Hybrid work environment - we believe in hiring the best talent, no matter where they are based. However, we love to build real connections and want to welcome everyone in the office on certain days.
Attractive compensation package.
Training and development budget which can be used for conferences and attending development courses to ensure continuous professional growth.
Flexible working hours, 28 vacation days and workation opportunities.
Enjoy unlimited access to a variety of fitness, yoga, and leisure activities via Wellpass.
Leverage exclusive offers with our corporate benefits portal, giving you access to compelling deals from leading brands.
Regular team events, game nights, and other social activities.
And last but not least: a beautiful office with flair in the heart of Berlin with all the conveniences, such as adjustable desks, social area, fresh fruits, cereals and drinks.
Is something missing here? Reach out and let's talk about what else you need for your ideal next growth opportunity.


Your Recruiting Process At Parloa

Recruiter video call → Hiring Manager Interview → Technical Stage (Coding Challenge + Machine Learning Case Study) → Meeting the team

Why Parloa?

Parloa is one of the fastest growing startups in the world of Generative AI and customer service. Parloa’s voice-first GenAI platform for contact centers is built on the best AI technology to automate customer service with natural-sounding conversations for outstanding experiences on all communication channels. Leveraging natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning, Parloa creates intelligent phone and chat solutions for businesses that turn contact centers into value centers by boosting customer service efficiency. The Parloa platform resolves the majority of customer queries quickly and automatically, allowing human agents to focus on complex issues and relationships. Parloa was founded in 2018 by Malte Kosub and Stefan Ostwald and today employs over 250 people in Berlin, Munich, and New York.

When you join Parloa, you become part of a dynamic and innovative team made up of over 34 nationalities that’s revolutionizing an entire industry. We’re passionate about growing together and creating opportunities for personal and professional development. With our recent $66 million Series B investment, we’re expanding globally and looking for talented individuals to join us on this exciting journey.

Do you have questions about Parloa, the role, or our team before you apply? Please feel free to get in touch with our Hiring Team.

Parloa is committed to upholding the highest data protection standards for our clients' and employees' data. All our employees are instrumental in ensuring the utmost care, GDPR, and ISO compliance, including ISO 27001, in handling sensitive information.


We provide equal opportunities to all qualified applicants regardless race, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, national origin, disability status, socioeconomic background and other characteristics.

title: Machine Learning Engineer, Applied AI
description:
The Role

Here at One.Five, Engineering, Machine Learning and Material Science play a vital role in our data-driven sustainable packaging development process. As we continue to grow, we’re looking for someone responsible for developing our novel Packaging Development AI Engine

As an experienced Machine Learning Engineer in Applied AI, you will use your skills to develop and integrate new AI and ML approaches to power our internal Material Science Platform.

This role reports to Marta Rodriguez, Head of Software and Data, and has as key stakeholders other data and software engineers, as well as team members throughout the company.

Given the remote first nature of our team, this role can be based anywhere but willing to work approx UTC/UTC+2 core hours, in order to overlap with the bulk of our European based team.

How you'll help build one


fıve


Develop our core AI Engine


You’ll bring state-of-the-art AI research from concept to implementation to create AI-driven applications with a direct impact on our packaging development processes.
You’ll work closely with stakeholders and other engineers to evaluate and optimize our systems for performance and accuracy and ensure they are production-ready.


Coordinate ML requirements with stakeholders


Surface requirements to other teams (data engineers, domain experts and software engineers) to ensure data harvesting and processing aligns with our AI development needs


Be our ML champion


You’ll lead our AI technical strategy by staying on top of the latest developments in machine learning and AI


Who You Are


Extensive hands-on experience of developing and implementing advanced machine learning or AI systems. Experience with Deep Learning or LLMs is preferred
Experience spearheading ML and data-heavy projects
Experience bringing machine learning applications to production (end to end development)
Strong programming skills in Python, familiarity with libraries and tools such as langchain/haystack, pytorch/tensorflow, spancy/nltk, scikit-learn, MLflow, GCP, VertexAI, etc.
Experience with vector databases and knowledge graph systems is a plus
Experience working with complex, scientific/chemistry-like data and metadata, such as lab generated measurements and experimental conditions, industrial trial data, etc.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently in a remote set up
Ability to work independently and proven stakeholder management
Experience implementing and coordinating with domain experts in multifunctional environments
Fluency in English, as this is our working language


one


fıve values
Duty to care: care for yourself, your colleagues, your work, our offices, and ultimately, our planet
Create with intent: work with a goal in mind. Ask yourself what you are trying to achieve and constantly evaluate whether your current path is the best way to achieve this goal
Acknowledge the process: we celebrate our failures and successes together, and keep iterating to improve
Transparency: all knowledge is accessible to everyone


Hiring Process

We want you to know what to expect out of your candidate experience with us and make this as much as possible a two sided process, allowing you to get to know us as well.

Once submitted, your CV will be reviewed by the People team, and shortlisted for interviews.

Everyone will be contacted to find out the outcome of their application.

We Have Four Interview Stages


Introduction Google Hangouts call with our Talent Manager - to share more about one.five and how we work & find out how that meets your experience and expectations of the role.
Technical interview with Head of Software & Data and another senior stakeholder - to dig into the day to day of the role more and answer any questions you may have for us.
Present a short demo of an ML project followed by brief Q&A.
Final introduction to key stakeholders in the business to better build your understanding of your future function, as well as discuss our core values.


Diversity & Inclusion

We are very proud of the culture we have built to support diversity & inclusion and will do everything we can to continue to be an inclusive company where all team members are comfortable, supported and empowered to succeed.

We seek to ensure that all employees are afforded equal opportunities and treatment, irrespective of any qualifier, in all aspects of recruitment, employment, training and determination of benefits.

For sake of clarity, all team members and candidates will receive equal treatment regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation.

If you require any accommodations for the interview process, please include them in your application or in scheduling requests for a first call.

About Us

Protecting our planet by developing materials for clean & closed material loops.

title: (Junior) AI Engineer (m/w/d)
description:
Das sind wir

Daten sind für uns nicht gleich Daten.

Du teilst unsere Mission "Mehr aus Daten rausholen"? Dann bist Du als Newbie oder erfahrenes Data Science Talent bei uns mehr als willkommen! Bei SKOPOS ELEMENTS unterstützen talentierte Data Scientists zukunftsorientierte Unternehmen und Menschen bei ihrem Weg zur Data Driven Company. Als Teil der SKOPOS GROUP sind wir seit 1995 führender Anbieter in der Marktforschung und beschäftigen aktuell über 140 Mitarbeitende.

Begleite unser Wachstum und nutze Deine Karrieremöglichkeit in unserem Data-Science-Team in Hürth bei Köln. Wir suchen Dich als Teamworker mit Herzblut.

Das sind Deine Aufgaben


Du setzt für die SKOPOS Group interne KI-Use-Cases um. Dafür nutzt du sowohl Large Language Models als auch eigene Modellentwicklungen für quantitative und Textdaten (überwiegend auf Deutsch und Englisch). Die Lösungen stellst du als Apps für das Unternehmen zur Verfügung.
Du unterstützt bei der Identifikation und Konzeption von KI-Lösungen, die von Mitarbeitenden aus unterschiedlichen Business Units verwendet werden.
Im Rahmen agiler Entwicklungsprozesse priorisierst du Aufgaben, stimmst dich mit Kolleginnen / Kollegen ab und stellst die erfolgreiche Umsetzung deiner Projekte sicher.
Du führst die Entwicklung und Implementierung von Produkten und Tools auf der Grundlage von Large Language Models (einschließlich ChatGPT-Versionen und eigenen Sprachmodellen) durch.
Du überwachst den Projektfortschritt und kümmerst dich eigenverantwortlich um die Lösung von (technischen) Problemen.
Du stellst die Aktualisierungen des Projektstatus für alle Beteiligten zur Verfügung.


Das bringst Du mit


Du hast durch dein Studium der Informatik, Mathematik, Statistik oder vergleichbarer Richtung bereits Erfahrung in der Software-Entwicklung gesammelt. Durch dein Interesse oder vorherige Tätigkeiten bringst du grundlegende Erfahrungen in der Entwicklung von Machine-Learning-Modellen mit.
Moderne Technologien aus dem AI-Bereich begeistern dich.
Du bringst fortgeschrittene Kenntnisse in der Python-Programmierung mit, sowie mit Versionierungen in git. Erfahrungen mit der Betreuung von Cloud-Ressourcen in Microsoft Azure, der Arbeit OpenAI-kompatiblen APIs und dem Python-Framework LangChain sind von Vorteil.
Du bist in der Lage, deine Projekte mit unterschiedlichen Stakeholdern abzustimmen, aber auch selbstständig zu arbeiten.
Du bist in der Lage, Strategien und Lösungen sowohl von internen als auch von externen Beteiligten effektiv zu vermitteln und hast die Fähigkeit, technische Probleme zu bewältigen.


Warum wir?


Flexibilität. Hybrides Arbeiten mit Anteil Office/ Mobile Office, flexibles Arbeitszeitmodell, Workation, Sabbaticals
Abwechslungsreiches Umfeld. Von Beginn an in spannende Projekte involviert.
Innovative, dynamische Arbeitsatmosphäre. Offene Du-Unternehmenskultur und Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe.
Aktive Mitgestaltung und Teamwork. Eigene Ideen und Erfahrungen zu neuen Produkten sind willkommen. Wir wachsen gemeinsam.
Entwicklung. Schritt für Schritt darfst Du Dich bei uns entwickeln. Zyklische Feedbackgespräche (Einarbeitungs-/Jahres- und Halbjahresgespräche, systematische Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten, SKOPOS School, Zertifizierung z.B. Tableau oder Alteryx).
Unbefristete Festanstellung.
Zuschuss zum Deutschlandticket oder ein kostenfreier Parkplatz im Euronova Campus Hürth.
Zuschüsse und Life-Balance. Zuschüsse zu Jobticket oder Jobrad, Corporate Benefits, Büromassage und Fitness-Studio, Getränkeflat im Office, Beteiligung an betrieblicher Altersvorsorge, Betriebsarzt, freier Rosenmontag und noch einiges mehr.
Nachhaltigkeit. Projekte zur Erreichung von Klimaneutralitätszielen, soziales Engagement, Unterstützung von NGOs.
Endlich wieder Events. Teamausflüge, Firmenfeiern, Jubiläumsfahrten, Weihnachtsfeiern oder einfach mal so nach Feierabend.


Und jetzt?

Wir freuen uns über Deine Bewerbung.

Dein Kontakt: Yannick Thomsen (SKOPOS GROUP) und Christopher Harms (SKOPOS ELEMENTS).

Tel. 02233/9988-880. SKOPOS ELEMENTS

title: Data Scientist
description:
About Us:

MetrixLab is a fast-growing global market research and insights company that’s challenging the status quo of insights. By blending evolving technology with passionate experts, MetrixLab helps global and local brands to drive more impact, and forges partnerships to drive sustainably equitable growth. From creative testing to brand tracking, and packaging to e-commerce optimization, MetrixLab’s range of solution suites adapts to fit all types of budgets, timelines and business needs.




Active in more than 90 countries, MetrixLab is a proud partner to more than half of the world’s top 100 brands and part of Toluna.




About the role:

Would you like to become part of a rapidly growing team with an exceptional client roster? We are seeking an ambitious Data Scientist to help drive the success and continued growth of MetrixLab. Primary objective of the role is to help the team design and deliver new analytical solutions to help our roster of clients.




To realize these commercial targets, you will:

Develop and execute marketing research analytical models
Help generate new data driven insights for clients.
Ensure a best fit solution that aligns with the client objective by providing analytic consulting and primary market research expertise
Know the methodology for each analytic techniques and communicate data insights and findings from them
Drive standardization and automation through ML-ops.




Competencies:

Degree in Engineering/Maths/Physics
5 years of experience with common marketing data science analyses, such as e.g. conjoints, max-diffs, drivers analysis, dimensionality reduction etc.
Very good command of English




What do we offer?

A challenging position in a dynamic, fast-paced, innovative, quickly growing global company.
A flexible work environment with a focus on owning and taking pride in your work.
(International) growth opportunities in line with your career ambitions and passions.
An open-culture work environment staffed with ambitious colleagues with “can-do” mentalities.
Global onboarding and frequent internal training and sharing opportunities.
Our employees have exclusive access to Udemy Business. With our company license, you have unlimited access to all external courses.
A competitive salary package including a good pension scheme, 25 paid days of leave, and full travel reimbursement (yes, that includes cycling!).

title: Robotics Engineer - AI
description:
sensmore is a pioneering AI software automation company, focused on developing state-of-the-art AI solutions for heavy machinery in extreme conditions.

We specialize in AI-powered technologies that enhance understanding and operational intelligence in harsh environments, enabling advanced driver assistance and autonomous functions for industries like mining, construction, and agriculture.

Join us and play a pivotal role in transforming the automation landscape in heavy industries.

Role Overview:

We are looking for a skilled Robotics Engineer with expertise in AI to enhance our team. This role requires a strong background in artificial intelligence, machine learning, and robotics. The successful candidate will be instrumental in developing and refining AI-driven robotics systems that improve navigation and perception under challenging conditions.

Key Responsibilities:


Design and implement AI algorithms for robotic systems to improve perception and navigation capabilities.
Optimize and refine AI systems that leverage radar and other sensory technologies.
Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to integrate these AI systems into larger robotic solutions.
Manage the full cycle of software development, from initial design through to implementation and ongoing maintenance.


Required Qualifications:


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Robotics, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
Proficient in Python or C++.
Solid understanding of machine learning, deep learning, and robotics.
Practical experience with robotic perception and image processing.
Experience with frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow.


Preferred Skills:


Practical experience with 3D vision in robotic applications.
Familiarity with multimodal machine learning models.
Knowledge of outdoor SLAM (Simultaneous Localization and Mapping) techniques.
Experience with radar data or similar sensory inputs.
Proven track record of publications or significant industry experience in deep learning and AI.


What We Offer:


A dynamic startup environment where you can make a substantial impact.
Competitive salary with equity options.
Flexible hours and hybrid working arrangements to balance personal and professional life.
A diverse, innovative team committed to technological excellence and groundbreaking solutions.
Extensive opportunities for professional development in a fast-growing technology company.


Benefits:


Attractive compensation package and stock options.
Beverages on-site and regular social events.
Engage with top-tier researchers, engineers, and thought leaders.
Influence the future of robotic technologies and tackle significant technological challenges.
Assistance with relocation to Berlin.
Flexible schedules emphasizing quality and productivity.


About Us:

sensmore is comprised of a diverse group of individuals whose varied backgrounds and perspectives fuel our innovation. We are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. Although we support remote work, our culture thrives on in-person interactions, which we find essential for tackling the complex problems we face. Our policy requires team members to work onsite at least 50% of the time.

title: Data Science Lead (f/m/d)
description:
As a Data Science Lead you will join a team of highly committed analysts, data engineers and developers and form our data science team.




At justtrack, we build a SaaS business that provides app and game publishers an attractive toolset to handle their entire global marketing growth process. Starting from managing, analyzing, and automating marketing processes justtrack enables gathering deep mobile product insights.




As part of the Applike Group (financially backed by media powerhouse Bertelsmann), justtrack has access to industry experts and funding with a long-term growth mindset.




You will start your onboarding in the Core team. Our team’s mission is to effortlessly gather, aggregate, and instantly provide all in-app event and marketing data to developers and marketers. Joining the Core team, you will have access to state of the art technology and work closely with our analysts, data engineers and developers owning our data lake and pipelines. You will form an independent data science team to implement new approaches on how to leverage our data assets with new algorithms and ideas.




Your exploratory data analysis will help us make the data speak by transforming recurring analyses into metrics and alerts.




We update our analytics tech stack frequently to adjust to our platform growth. Therefore, we offer plenty of opportunities to learn. Knowledge exchange is fostered by regular workshops.




How the optimal candidate will look like:

You have 5+ years of experience in applying Data Science/ML in real-life tasks where the projects had measurable business value
You have a Master’s degree in Data Science/Applied Mathematics or a related field
Expert knowledge of Python and SQL
You have an entrepreneurial and hacker mindset, when there is a tough problem it motivates you to drill deeper
You easily switch between move-fast- and no-margin-for-error-modes
You are able to dive deep into math and explain complex topics in an easy way




Key responsibilities:

You scale the team and mentor a small team of data scientists and analysts
Drive the development of our data science tech stack by looking for innovation opportunities and steering the implementation by our development team
Hand in hand with our developers you transform recurring analyses into metrics, charts, business related messages and the underlying data storage and pipelines
You will work on ML models to notify our users about detected trends and statistical outliers in real-time
You extract knowledge and actionable insights from noisy, structured and unstructured data
You perform exploratory data analysis to determine correlations and trends
You drill into data from various sources (Redshift, Spark, SQL, Athena, S3, Druid event streams, AWS data pipeline)




What we have to offer:

Work-Life Package: 2 remote days per week, 30 vacation days, 3 weeks per year of remote work, flexible working hours, dog-friendly kick-ass office in the center of the city.
Relocation Package: Visa & legal support, relocation bonus, reimbursement of German Classes costs, and more.
Happy Belly Package: Monthly company lunch, tons of free snacks and drinks, free breakfast & fresh delicious pastries every Monday
Physical & Mental Health Package: In-house gym with a personal trainer, various classes like Yoga with expert teachers & free of charge access to our EAP (Employee Assistance Program) to support your mental health and well-being
Activity Package: Regular team and company events, and hackathons.
Education Package: Opportunities to boost your professional development with courses and training directly connected to your career goals
Wealth building: virtual stock options for all our regular employees




Skip writing cover letters. Tell us about your most passionate personal project, your desired salary and your earliest possible start date. We are looking forward to your application!




We welcome applications from people who will contribute to the diversity of our company.

Show more

title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
description:
Are you an AI, Machine Learning or NLP Engineer with great Software Development skills?




Are you passionate about putting your skills towards developing an Intelligent Business Platform that is set to revolutionize a 45 Billion Dollar Industry?




Do you thrive on applying cutting-edge Machine Learning techniques to solve complex, real-world problems?




Is the thought of creating algorithms that will transform how companies make decisions, manage resources, and drive innovation worldwide, seem exciting to you?




Then we want to hear from you!




My client is developing an innovative Intelligent Enterprise Systems company, backed by Venture Capital. They're redefining how businesses interact with their data and processes, leveraging the power of AI to develop ground-breaking solutions for customizable, intelligent business platforms.




Imagine creating AI models that can predict supply chain disruptions before they happen, or developing natural language interfaces that allow executives to query complex business data as easily as chatting with a colleague.




These are the very sorts of cutting-edge applications that you will be building. Harnessing data from diverse business processes, you will build advanced LLM and Transformer-based applications to optimize operations, enhance user productivity, and create more engaging experiences across various industries. Your work will directly influence how thousands of companies around the world operate and innovate in their respective fields.




We're seeking a passionate and motivated AI Engineer to join a world-class team of developers and product managers. You are someone who excels in Python, has a strong background in Machine Learning, NLP, LLM or Transformers and can take ownership of complex AI challenges from research to deployment.




You'll have the opportunity to:




Cutting-Edge AI Development: Apply your expertise to build AI infrastructure, tools, and pipelines that empower customers and application developers.
Impactful Projects: Develop a business user co-pilot, create natural language interfaces, and build document extraction (OCR) tools using multimodal models.
Innovative Technology: Work with LLMs in production and fine-tune open-source models to push the boundaries of AI in Intelligent Business Systems.
Collaborative Excellence: Join a team of world-class developers and expert product managers passionate about AI and Enterprise Software.




In return, you'll join a dynamic, innovative team at the forefront of business technology. You'll experience the agility and innovation of a startup, backed by the resources and market opportunity of an established player in a massive, growing market. You'll participate in collaborative projects, engaging discussions on the future of enterprise software, and have the chance to directly impact millions of businesses worldwide.




Working at the intersection of AI, cloud computing, and enterprise software, you'll develop a unique skill set that will put you at the forefront of the next wave of business technology. Along with a competitive package, you'll be part of a culture that's passionate about solving some of the most significant challenges in modern business operations.




Ideally you are:




A PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics or Machine Learning who has demonstrable software engineering skills
Fluent in Python
Experience in Language AI - utilizing Transformer, LLM or multi-modal Models




We are also hiring for senior profiles for this role so if you have 3+ years of experience as a Software Engineer, have worked on projects putting LLMs into production, and are excited about shaping the future of how businesses operate, we'd love to talk to you!




Don't miss this chance to be at the forefront of AI-driven enterprise solutions and make a lasting impact on the business world!

title: Lead/Senior Scientist Artificial Intelligence (m/f/d)
description:
The Artificial Intelligence & Computer Vision (AICV) group at the R&D center of Korro AI in Darmstadt is executing applied research and technology transfer into cutting-edge products. Our ventures encompass a broad spectrum of new technologies in the realms of Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Large Language Models (LLMs), providing a rich ground to transition ideas from conception to real-world applications.




In this context, the Lead/Senior Scientist Artificial Intelligence will contribute her/his skills and knowledge within an interdisciplinary team, collaborating with domain experts to design and implement novel AI solutions. She/he will take responsibility for investigating and developing innovative algorithms to extract valuable insights and knowledge across broad application areas. She/he may advise graduate students and coordinate their activity with members of the research teams. The candidate should have a robust foundation in machine learning and a solid interest in adapting state of the art AI and Natural Language Understanding algorithms for high-performance applications and impacting industry by working on actual projects. She/he should be committed to ethical AI practices.




Responsibilities

Drive and contribute to the development of new AI, Machine Learning and NLP algorithms and products
Conduct research and coordinate work with peers, teams, external partners and customers to develop a technology foundation
Deliver project results as part of the overall project plan and ensure seamless integration into our products




Education / Certification Requirements

Master’s degree or equivalent in AI, Machine Learning, Computer Vision, NLP or related disciplines is a must
Doctorate degree or equivalent in AI, Machine Learning, Computer Vision, NLP or related disciplines is beneficial




Skills and Experience

Advanced knowledge and experience in methods for AI, Machine Learning, Computer Vision or similar field
Advanced programming proficiency in Python, C++, or Kotlin are a plus
Advanced experience with Deep Learning frameworks like Torch, Tensorflow, Jax, etc.
Experience in one of the following areas is beneficial: real-time machine learning models on mobile devices, large scale model training and/or finetuning (LLMs, VLMs, stable diffusion, multimodal), creating large and high quality datasets
Fluent in English

title: Data Scientist (all genders)
description:
Position: (Senior) Data Scientist (all genders)

Standort: NRW

Arbeitsvertrag: Vollzeit/Unbefristet

Arbeitsumstände: Hybrid (70/30)

Arbeitssprache: Deutsch

Gehaltsband: bis zu 90K€




Deine Aufgaben

- Führende Rolle bei Advanced Analytics-Projekten im Lebensmittelhandel, zur Optimierung von Entscheidungsprozessen und Förderung der Data-Science-Strategie.

- End-to-End Entwicklung und Produktion von Modellen und Machine-Learning-Pipelines, verantwortlich für Prognosen, Klassifikationen und Scoring.

- Datenmanagement von strukturierten und unstrukturierten Daten in verschiedenen Datenbanksystemen (z.B. GCP/BigQuery, teradata) sowie Analyse-Frameworks (z.B. Hadoop/Spark).

- Starkes analytisches und konzeptionelles Denkvermögen sowie ausgezeichnete kommunikative Fähigkeiten.

Patrick Trent - pt@baumlink.com

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - ML Ops Platform (f/m/d)*
description:
YOUR MISSION

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Language Platform (f/m/d)*, you will build, scale and improve Parloa’s platform to evaluate and fine-tune machine learning models required to extend Parloa to new languages. As a member of our AI & Data Science team, you will take ownership of models for speech-to-text, entity recognition and translation. You will ensure our models generate high quality data for our generative AI, NLU and real-time translation products. You will work closely with product teams to help them solve customer problems with machine learning and AI. You will leverage cutting edge technologies to keep sharpening Parloa’s competitive edge to transform the entire customer service industry with AI.

In This Role You Will


Develop a platform to automate the evaluation and fine-tuning of our language models (speech to text, entity recognition, translation, anonymization)
Execute machine learning projects end-to-end: understanding user-facing requirements, data gathering and transformation, exploratory data analysis, model productionization, maintenance and support, continuous improvement
Work closely with data platform and product engineers to shape our technical product vision and strategy to make Parloa internationally scalable
Build and improve our ML platform (ML / LLM Ops) in collaboration with data platform and DevOps


Our Tech stack (Data): Microsoft Azure, Python, Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform, MongoDB, Redis (more technologies will added as we build our data and Machine Learning platforms)

What You Bring To The Table


7+ years of experience as a machine learning engineer, 3+ years of experience in ML Operations or data platform engineering
Strong engineering background and experience in machine learning operations
Strong proficiency in Python, proficiency with SQL
Experience with owning the ML process end-to-end: translating product requirements into technical requirements, data gathering/transformation and exploration, model productionization, maintenance, monitoring and optimization
Experience working with text/voice data
Experience in leading medium-sized technical projects (3-9 months roadmap)
Strong spoken and written communication skills in English


WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?


Be part of a dynamic, driven team of +20 nationalities with flat hierarchies and collaborative company culture.
Hybrid work environment - we believe in hiring the best talent, no matter where they are based. However, we love to build real connections and want to welcome everyone in the office on certain days.
Attractive compensation package.
Training and development budget which can be used for conferences and attending development courses to ensure continuous professional growth.
Flexible working hours, 28 vacation days and workation opportunities.
Enjoy unlimited access to a variety of fitness, yoga, and leisure activities via Wellpass.
Leverage exclusive offers with our corporate benefits portal, giving you access to compelling deals from leading brands.
Regular team events, game nights, and other social activities.
And last but not least: a beautiful office with flair in the heart of Berlin with all the conveniences, such as adjustable desks, social area, fresh fruits, cereals and drinks.
Is something missing here? Reach out and let's talk about what else you need for your ideal next growth opportunity.


Your Recruiting Process At Parloa

Recruiter video call → Hiring Manager Interview → Technical Stage (Coding Challenge + Machine Learning Case Study) → Meeting the team

Why Parloa?

Parloa is one of the fastest growing startups in the world of Generative AI and customer service. Parloa’s voice-first GenAI platform for contact centers is built on the best AI technology to automate customer service with natural-sounding conversations for outstanding experiences on all communication channels. Leveraging natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning, Parloa creates intelligent phone and chat solutions for businesses that turn contact centers into value centers by boosting customer service efficiency. The Parloa platform resolves the majority of customer queries quickly and automatically, allowing human agents to focus on complex issues and relationships. Parloa was founded in 2018 by Malte Kosub and Stefan Ostwald and today employs over 250 people in Berlin, Munich, and New York.

When you join Parloa, you become part of a dynamic and innovative team made up of over 34 nationalities that’s revolutionizing an entire industry. We’re passionate about growing together and creating opportunities for personal and professional development. With our recent $66 million Series B investment, we’re expanding globally and looking for talented individuals to join us on this exciting journey.

Do you have questions about Parloa, the role, or our team before you apply? Please feel free to get in touch with our Hiring Team.

Parloa is committed to upholding the highest data protection standards for our clients' and employees' data. All our employees are instrumental in ensuring the utmost care, GDPR, and ISO compliance, including ISO 27001, in handling sensitive information.


We provide equal opportunities to all qualified applicants regardless race, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, national origin, disability status, socioeconomic background and other characteristics.

title: Machine Learning Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
Berlin, India, Remote

________________________

Hello 👋 I am Adriano, Machine Learning Lead at Kayzen, and I am now looking for a Machine Learning Engineer who will be a part of the machine learning engineering team bridging the gap between machine learning and ad systems engineering team 🙌

But wait, you have not heard of Kayzen before? 😃

Kayzen powers the world's best mobile marketing teams to take programmatic advertising in-house. Built on the three key pillars of performance, transparency and control, Kayzen is a DSP which enables leading app developers, agencies, media buyers and D2C brands to run programmatic user acquisition, retargeting, and branding campaigns in self-serve or managed service mode.

With an unprecedented scale of >160bn daily ad requests from 2bn+ unique users worldwide, we serve more than 500M ads per day to 180 countries. Kayzen is accessible through our APIs or user interface.

The role

Are you a problem-solver, passionate about pushing the boundaries of machine learning in production? Do you thrive in a collaborative environment where you can both lead and be led, contributing your expertise while learning from others?

At Kayzen, we're revolutionizing the AdTech space with machine learning, and we're looking for a dedicated and proactive Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join our team. If you love the Machine learning craft and want to help us build a world-class ML infrastructure and processes, we want to hear from you!

Day to day

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you'll be a key member of the Machine Learning Engineering team, bridging the gap between data science and ad systems engineering. You'll tackle the challenge of creating innovative solutions for petabyte-scale data models. Your work will span a wide range, from developing libraries and infrastructure to accelerate experimentation and deploying hundreds of models, to researching cutting-edge technologies.


Accelerate Experimentation and Deployment: Create solutions to streamline our model experimentation and deployment processes.
Robust Model Monitoring: Maintain and enhance our model monitoring capabilities to ensure optimal performance in production.
Collaborate with Data Scientists: Partner with data scientists to develop new models, research novel methods, and create the best models for each use case within our AdTech platform.
Productionize Pipelines: Develop and productionize model creation pipelines for our ML models in both bare-metal and cloud environments.
Drive Innovation: Propose and lead projects to continuously improve our machine learning capabilities.
Team Player: Contribute to a culture of continuous learning and improvement within the team.
Champion Software Engineering Best Practices: Promote and implement software engineering best practices (version control, code review, testing, CI/CD) to ensure the reliability, maintainability, and scalability of our machine learning systems


Sounds like you? 😉


Experienced Practitioner: 5+ years of proven professional experience in deploying big data-based models from conceptualization to deployment, ensuring sustained performance in production.
Machine Learning Mastery: Proven experience with Machine Learning techniques (Neural Networks, Random Forest, etc.) and ML frameworks (Catboost, Mlflow, PyTorch, Tensorflow, etc.).
Programming Proficiency: Fluency in relevant programming languages (Python, Java, etc.).
Data Expertise: Strong proficiency in SQL & NoSQL and big data processing pipelines (we use Python, Spark, Airflow).
Quantitative Background: Bachelor's/Master's degree in Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Machine Learning Engineering or a related field.
Data Enthusiast: A genuine passion for working with data and uncovering insights.
Problem Solver: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to tackle complex challenges.
Business Acumen: Ability to translate business requirements into solutions.
Effective Communication: Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills.


Nice to have:


Deep Learning Experience: Familiarity with deep learning techniques and applications.
Clickhouse & AdTech: Prior experience with Clickhouse and/or the ad-tech industry.
Real-Time Processing: Experience with real-time big data processing.


What do we offer?


Exceptional career growth and learning opportunity
A unique opportunity to be part of an experienced team of industry experts and entrepreneurs who bring massive change to the Adtech market
Direct, day-to-day work experience with the management
A fun, driven, and multinational team located across Germany, India, Argentina, Ukraine, Turkey, the UK and soon more countries
A flexible work-from-home arrangement
A 500-dollar home-office setup budget
A 1000-dollar annual learning and development budget

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Are you eager to develop a deep understanding of data and define success before jumping into algorithms? If you're a creator who challenges the status quo and brings innovative ideas to the table, we want to connect with you! Join us in transforming the entertainment industry with cutting-edge, custom-built tools and help elevate our data-driven solutions to new heights.




Who We're Looking For:

Take ownership of the core data products that fuel our business operations.
Refine our automated campaign management system, ensuring every project is delivered accurately and on time.
Contribute to the development of our advanced hybrid interest signals data platform.
Partner directly with our founders to shape the strategic direction of the business, leading your team to consistently meet deadlines.
Enhance our targeting capabilities by extracting maximum insights from our recommendation system, powered by extensive user and item data.




What You Bring:

Expertise in machine learning and data science, with a focus on delivering actionable solutions rather than purely academic achievements.
A problem-solver who derives satisfaction from delivering impactful business results and asking the right questions.
A systems thinker who naturally understands data and defines success before diving into algorithm development.
A commitment to continuous learning, achieving tangible results, and creating value—key traits we look for in every team member.




What You'll Be Doing:

Build on years of data engineering expertise and a wealth of high-quality data, creating models from day one. You'll iterate using proven technologies like Snowflake, Python, Pytorch, Scipy, and XGBoost, introducing complexity only where it adds significant value.
Rapidly develop prototypes based on smart assumptions, focusing on quick iteration rather than spending months trying to outperform state-of-the-art solutions.
Work with our advanced internal Recommendations-ML-Engine, tackling classical (non-)linear optimization problems, tabular modeling, forecasting, normalization, and NLP.
Draw from existing research to enhance your work, rather than starting from scratch.




Apply now!

title: AI Engineer - Germany
description:
This is a remote position.

Note: One of our clients is building a new team and hiring 8 AI Engineers globally. This is a 100% remote role. This role does not offer any visa sponsorship.

Job Summary:

As an AI Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing AI models and algorithms that solve complex business problems. You will work closely with data scientists, software engineers, and product teams to integrate AI solutions into our products. Your role will involve researching the latest AI technologies, building scalable machine learning models, and optimizing algorithms for performance and accuracy.

Key Responsibilities:


Design, develop, and deploy AI models and algorithms that address business needs and challenges.
Collaborate with data scientists and software engineers to collect, preprocess, and analyze large datasets.
Implement machine learning and deep learning models using frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras.
Optimize and tune models for performance, accuracy, and scalability.
Integrate AI solutions into production systems, ensuring seamless operation and reliability.
Research and stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI, machine learning, and data science.
Develop and maintain documentation for AI models, processes, and best practices.
Participate in code reviews and provide feedback to ensure high-quality code and adherence to best practices.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to AI models and systems in production environments.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure AI solutions align with business goals and objectives.


Qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in AI, machine learning, or a related field.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Java.
Experience with machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, or Scikit-learn.
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms, neural networks, natural language processing (NLP), and computer vision.
Experience with data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation techniques.
Familiarity with cloud platforms and tools for AI and machine learning (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure).
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work with complex datasets.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Ability to manage multiple projects and deliver results on time.


Preferred Qualifications:


Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or Kafka.
Knowledge of reinforcement learning, generative models, or advanced neural architectures.
Familiarity with DevOps practices for AI/ML, including CI/CD pipelines and containerization.
Relevant certifications in AI or machine learning.
