title: Research Associate (m/f/x)
description:
TUD Dresden University of Technology, as a University of Excellence, is one of the leading and most dynamic research institutions in the country. Founded in 1828, today it is a globally oriented, regionally anchored top university as it focuses on the grand challenges of the 21st century. It develops innovative solutions for the world's most pressing issues. In research and academic programs, the university unites the natural and engineering sciences with the humanities, social sciences and medicine. This wide range of disciplines is a special feature, facilitating interdisciplinarity and transfer of science to society. As a modern employer, it offers attractive working conditions to all employees in teaching, research, technology and administration. The goal is to promote and develop their individual abilities while empowering everyone to reach their full potential. TUD embodies a university culture that is characterized by cosmopolitanism, mutual appreciation, thriving innovation and active participation. For TUD diversity is an essential feature and a quality criterion of an excellent university. Accordingly, we welcome all applicants who would like to commit themselves, their achievements and productivity to the success of the whole institution.

At the Faculty of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Institute of Communication Technology, the Vodafone Chair of Mobile Communications Systems offers a position as

Research Associate (m/f/x)

(subject to personal qualification employees are remunerated according to salary group E 13 TV-L)

starting at the earliest possible date. The position is limited to 18 months with the option of extension. The period of employment is governed by the Fixed Term Research Contracts Act (Wissenschaftszeitvertragsgesetz - WissZeitVG). The position offers the chance to obtain further academic qualification.

The Vodafone Chair for Mobile Communications Systems offers the opportunity to help shape the development of future mobile communication systems in a prosperous and dynamic environment, to gain valuable project experience and to establish and deepen contacts with innovative companies. Further information on the Vodafone Chair can be found at https://mns.ifn.et.tu-dresden.de/. The research at the Vodafone Chair runs within the scope of DFG, EU and BMBF projects as well as within the framework of an ERC Synergy Grant.

Tasks: you will conduct research in the field of wireless communications technology on one of the following topics:


Development and evaluation of resilient wireless systems for
spectrum sensing, channel modeling, radio resource management, anti-jamming
machine learning and digital twinning
applications in industry and medicine
Transmission and signal processing techniques for joint communication and sensing, including waveform and frame design, parameter estimation algorithms, and applications of sensing such as localization.
Beamforming architectures and techniques for massive ultrawideband MIMO
Gearbox PHY concept: design of multi-gear radio interface, and optimization of the operation using AI/ML techniques for gear switching and dynamic reconfiguration
Physical layer design for ultra-energy-efficient wireless spike-based sensor node communication, including optimized spike modulation, stochastic modeling of a spike-based signal processing chain, and task-based communication.
Algorithm design for innovative quasi-optical terabit/sec wireless communications systems with energy-efficient oversampled 1-bit quantization: digital baseband design including the study of optimal modulation, channel estimation, and receiver synchronization algorithms
Field testing with our own 5G SA Campus Networks including ORAN
Mobile network measurements with best-in-class equipment and process automation
Airborne RF measurements using 5G connected drones
Communications and control co-design for wireless-networked control systems
Reduction of latency requirements for cyber-physical systems using model-based prediction and estimation
Learning for dynamical systems and control using data-driven/ML techniques

All tasks are carried out in cooperation with partners from industry and science. The field of activity also includes the supervision of student work related to the research topics. The results of the work are to be published at international conferences and in distinguished journals.

Requirements: an above-average university degree in the field of computer science, electrical engineering, communications engineering or information systems engineering; profound knowledge of wireless communications, communications engineering and digital signal processing; independent, goal- and solution-oriented approach; integrative and cooperative behavior with very good communication and social skills; confident command of written and spoken English.

TUD strives to employ more women in academia and research. We therefore expressly encourage women to apply. The University is a certified family-friendly university and offers a Dual Career Service. We welcome applications from candidates with disabilities. If multiple candidates prove to be equally qualified, those with disabilities or with equivalent status pursuant to the German Social Code IX (SGB IX) will receive priority for employment.

Please submit your detailed application with the usual documents by August 30, 2024 (stamped arrival date of the university central mail service of TUD applies) stating the Job-ID w24-280 to jobs@ifn.et.tu-dresden.de (Please note: We are currently not able to receive electronically signed and encrypted data) or to: TU Dresden, Fakultät Elektrotechnik und Informationstechnik, Institut für Nachrichtentechnik, Vodafone Stiftungsprofessur für Mobile Nachrichtensysteme, Herrn Prof. Gerhard Fettweis, Helmholtzstr. 10, 01069 Dresden, Germany. Please submit copies only, as your application will not be returned to you. Expenses incurred in attending interviews cannot be reimbursed.

Reference to data protection: Your data protection rights, the purpose for which your data will be processed, as well as further information about data protection is available to you on the website: https://tu-dresden.de/karriere/datenschutzhinweis.

title: Machine Learning Engineer - Freelance
description:
Position: Freelance Machine Learning Engineer

Location: Remote (Germany-based)

Duration: 9 months+

Language: Proficiency in German preferred




Responsibilities:

Collaborate with clients to grasp project requirements and goals effectively.
Devise and implement tailored machine learning models and algorithms.
Optimize machine learning pipelines for scalability and efficiency.
Conduct rigorous testing and validation to ensure model accuracy and reliability.
Offer technical guidance and support to clients throughout project execution.
Deliver clear and concise updates on project progress, challenges, and outcomes.




Requirements:

Strong proficiency in Machine Learning techniques and algorithms.

title: Research Associate (m/f/x)
description:
TUD Dresden University of Technology, as a University of Excellence, is one of the leading and most dynamic research institutions in the country. Founded in 1828, today it is a globally oriented, regionally anchored top university as it focuses on the grand challenges of the 21st century. It develops innovative solutions for the world's most pressing issues. In research and academic programs, the university unites the natural and engineering sciences with the humanities, social sciences and medicine. This wide range of disciplines is a special feature, facilitating interdisciplinarity and transfer of science to society. As a modern employer, it offers attractive working conditions to all employees in teaching, research, technology and administration. The goal is to promote and develop their individual abilities while empowering everyone to reach their full potential. TUD embodies a university culture that is characterized by cosmopolitanism, mutual appreciation, thriving innovation and active participation. For TUD diversity is an essential feature and a quality criterion of an excellent university. Accordingly, we welcome all applicants who would like to commit themselves, their achievements and productivity to the success of the whole institution.

At the Faculty of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Institute of Communication Technology, the Vodafone Chair of Mobile Communications Systems offers a position as

Research Associate (m/f/x)

(subject to personal qualification employees are remunerated according to salary group E 13 TV-L)

starting at the earliest possible date. The position is limited to 18 months with the option of extension. The period of employment is governed by the Fixed Term Research Contracts Act (Wissenschaftszeitvertragsgesetz - WissZeitVG). The position offers the chance to obtain further academic qualification.

The Vodafone Chair for Mobile Communications Systems offers the opportunity to help shape the development of future mobile communication systems in a prosperous and dynamic environment, to gain valuable project experience and to establish and deepen contacts with innovative companies. Further information on the Vodafone Chair can be found at https://mns.ifn.et.tu-dresden.de/. The research at the Vodafone Chair runs within the scope of DFG, EU and BMBF projects as well as within the framework of an ERC Synergy Grant.

Tasks: you will conduct research in the field of wireless communications technology on one of the following topics:


Development and evaluation of resilient wireless systems for
spectrum sensing, channel modeling, radio resource management, anti-jamming
machine learning and digital twinning
applications in industry and medicine
Transmission and signal processing techniques for joint communication and sensing, including waveform and frame design, parameter estimation algorithms, and applications of sensing such as localization.
Beamforming architectures and techniques for massive ultrawideband MIMO
Gearbox PHY concept: design of multi-gear radio interface, and optimization of the operation using AI/ML techniques for gear switching and dynamic reconfiguration
Physical layer design for ultra-energy-efficient wireless spike-based sensor node communication, including optimized spike modulation, stochastic modeling of a spike-based signal processing chain, and task-based communication.
Algorithm design for innovative quasi-optical terabit/sec wireless communications systems with energy-efficient oversampled 1-bit quantization: digital baseband design including the study of optimal modulation, channel estimation, and receiver synchronization algorithms
Field testing with our own 5G SA Campus Networks including ORAN
Mobile network measurements with best-in-class equipment and process automation
Airborne RF measurements using 5G connected drones
Communications and control co-design for wireless-networked control systems
Reduction of latency requirements for cyber-physical systems using model-based prediction and estimation
Learning for dynamical systems and control using data-driven/ML techniques

All tasks are carried out in cooperation with partners from industry and science. The field of activity also includes the supervision of student work related to the research topics. The results of the work are to be published at international conferences and in distinguished journals.

Requirements: an above-average university degree in the field of computer science, electrical engineering, communications engineering or information systems engineering; profound knowledge of wireless communications, communications engineering and digital signal processing; independent, goal- and solution-oriented approach; integrative and cooperative behavior with very good communication and social skills; confident command of written and spoken English.

TUD strives to employ more women in academia and research. We therefore expressly encourage women to apply. The University is a certified family-friendly university and offers a Dual Career Service. We welcome applications from candidates with disabilities. If multiple candidates prove to be equally qualified, those with disabilities or with equivalent status pursuant to the German Social Code IX (SGB IX) will receive priority for employment.

Please submit your detailed application with the usual documents by August 30, 2024 (stamped arrival date of the university central mail service of TUD applies) stating the Job-ID w24-280 to jobs@ifn.et.tu-dresden.de (Please note: We are currently not able to receive electronically signed and encrypted data) or to: TU Dresden, Fakultät Elektrotechnik und Informationstechnik, Institut für Nachrichtentechnik, Vodafone Stiftungsprofessur für Mobile Nachrichtensysteme, Herrn Prof. Gerhard Fettweis, Helmholtzstr. 10, 01069 Dresden, Germany. Please submit copies only, as your application will not be returned to you. Expenses incurred in attending interviews cannot be reimbursed.

Reference to data protection: Your data protection rights, the purpose for which your data will be processed, as well as further information about data protection is available to you on the website: https://tu-dresden.de/karriere/datenschutzhinweis.

title: Machine Learning Engineer (m/w/d)
description:
Deine Aufgaben

Als Machine Learning Engineer (m/w/d) Bei Natif.ai Spielst Du Eine Entscheidende Rolle Bei Der Weiterentwicklung Unserer Technologie Zur Intelligenten Dokumentenverarbeitung. Du Nutzt 15 Petaflops Rechenleistung, Um Deine Innovationen Voranzutreiben. Du Verfolgst Die Neuesten Forschungstrends Und Musst Dir Dabei Keine Gedanken Über Datenbeschränkungen Bei Unseren Massiven, Hochwertigen Datensätzen Machen. Deine Hauptaufgaben Sind


Du trainierst und verfeinerst neuronale Netze und verschiebst die Grenzen dessen, was Dokumenten-KI leisten kann
Du arbeitest am Kern unserer Technologie zur automatisierten Dokumentenverarbeitung, die auf Computer Vision und Natural Language Processing basiert
Du hältst Dich über die neuesten Trends im Bereich Machine Learning auf dem Laufenden und implementierst und verbesserst unsere hochmodernen Modelle
Du arbeitest mit dem Tech-Team zusammen, um neue Machine-Learning-Möglichkeiten zu definieren und durchzuführen


Dein Profil


Du hast einen Abschluss in Mathematik, Statistik, Physik, Informatik oder einem verwandten Studiengang; eine Promotion ist ein Plus
Du hast eine solide Grundlage in allgemeiner Softwareentwicklung, insbesondere in Python
Du verfügst über fundierte Kenntnisse und Erfahrungen im Bereich des Machine Learning und des Deep Learning (z.B. CNN, RNNs, Transformatoren, etc.)
Du hast bereits praktische Erfahrung mit gängigen Machine Learning Bibliotheken und Frameworks wie TensorFlow, PyTorch, OpenCV, NumPy, HuggingFace, etc. gesammelt
Du kannst sowohl eigenständig als auch im Team arbeiten, Du bist aufgeschlossen und bereit, mit uns die Grenzen von unserer KI weiter zu verschieben
Du sprichst fließend Deutsch und/oder Englisch


Warum wir?


Innovation erleben: Werde Teil eines innovativen Unternehmens, dessen Ziel es ist, Marktführer im Bereich KI-gestützter Dokumentenautomatisierung zu werden
Abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben: Arbeite an vielfältigen Aufgaben, spannenden Herausforderungen und innovativen Projekten in einer schnell wachsenden Organisation
Kreativität entfalten: Genieße eine große Freiheit zur Entfaltung Deiner kreativen Ideen und arbeite direkt mit wichtigen Entscheidungsträgern und KI-Experten zusammen
Mitgestalten: Bringe Deine eigenen Ideen ein und gestalte gemeinsam mit uns die Zukunft des Unternehmens
Weiterentwicklung: Wir streben nach Exzellenz in allem, was wir tun, und somit möchten wir Dir auch eine exzellente persönliche und berufliche Weiterentwicklung ermöglichen
Offene Unternehmenskultur: Arbeite in einer offenen Unternehmenskultur mit flachen Hierarchien und einem diversen, interdisziplinären Team
Attraktive Vergütung: Profitiere von einem wettbewerbsfähigen Gehaltspaket, regelmäßigen Teamveranstaltungen und einer Vielzahl weiterer Vorteile
Work-Life-Balance: Wir legen großen Wert auf die Balance zwischen Beruf und Privatleben. Flexible Arbeitszeiten und die Möglichkeit zum Arbeiten aus dem Homeoffice garantieren diese Balance


Kontaktinformationen

Deine Ansprechpartnerin

Charlotte Risch

Human Resources

charlotte.risch@natif.ai

+49 160 819 71 58

Über uns

Wir von natif.ai haben es uns zur Aufgabe gemacht, die Arbeit von Tausenden von Beschäftigten zu vereinfachen. Schon heute verarbeitet unsere KI Millionen von Dokumenten pro Monat und hilft somit unseren Kunden, Zeit und Geld einzusparen, indem sie Dokumentenverarbeitungsprozesse automatisiert, Fehler reduziert und die Produktivität steigert. Unsere Vision ist es, dass irgendwann überhaupt keine Dokumente mehr manuell bearbeitet werden müssen. Unser Ziel ist es daher, diese KI-Revolution als eins der innovativsten Unternehmen auf diesem Gebiet voranzutreiben. Komplexe Workflows, hochmoderne KI-Technologien und Active Learning mit nur wenigen Zeilen Code, sofort einsatzbereit - das ist unser Produktversprechen. Ein tolles Team, viel Platz für Deine eigenen Ideen, hohe Flexibilität und eine gute Work-Life-Balance, kombiniert mit jeder Menge Spaß - das ist unser Versprechen an unsere Mitarbeiter:innen.

Du willst uns auf unserer Mission begleiten? Dann bewirb Dich jetzt und werde Teil unseres Teams!

9388

Area

Transformation

01.09.2024

Permanent

München |

UniCredit Bank GmbH is continuously extending its Data & Analytics activities. The Data and Intelligence Office plays a crucial role both in terms of managing the underlying data as well as providing analytical capabilities to the business and control functions of the bank. For this position we are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer with experience in Artificial Intelligence applications and the practical application of Generative AI. You will be involved in the development and maintenance of machine learning models to support automation of critical business processes and applications. With your technical and personal competence, you will join a team responsible for the building of Data & AI products for the bank utilizing our big data platform.

What you can expect from us

In this position you will be facing the following tasks:


Explore and extract the value from data by applying up to data Generative AI techniques enabling the Businesses and Competence Lines of UniCredit Group to generate new sources of revenues or cost efficiencies opportunities
Manage and analyze multiple sources and datasets with the purpose of detecting unexpected regularities and patterns in available data to discover new insights using Generative AI
Apply up to date software development practices
Use big data to define predictive models and anticipate future outcomes: application of machine learning techniques required to achieve that
Hypothesis testing: developing hypothesis and testing them with careful experiments


What we expect from you


Master Degree in Applied Mathematics, Actuarial Science, Statistics, Data Science or Computer Science or comparable education
2+ years of experience in a Machine Learning / software engineering / Generative AI role
Excellent knowledge of Data Analysis, AI, & ML
Excellent knowledge in the application of Generative AI
Excellent knowledge in the application of PySpark
Experience with Microsoft Azure or Google Cloud
Goal-oriented, structured and independent way of working
High level of commitment and ability to work under pressure as well as a convincing and confident manner
Ability to adapt to a dynamic, constantly changing environment
Distinct social competence and ability to work in a team
Ability to work in English


Our offer to you

#JoinOurTeam - Our employees are the driving force behind our success and thus our greatest asset. Because we are aware of our responsibility as an employer, we have once again been awarded the title of Top Employer. Become part of our team. #MakeInnovationHappen - FinTechs, Big Data, Bitcoins: The banking industry is developing rapidly. Actively shape the digital transformation of one of the most changing industries by contributing your fresh perspective and innovative ideas. #ComeAsYouAre - We are committed to a fair and integrative coexistence. That is why we have signed the Diversity Charter, are part of the Valuable 500 and support people with disabilities in the world of work. UniCorns represent our LGBTQI+ colleagues, while we ensure equal opportunities with our Gender Diversity Program. Inclusion is a responsibility that we are aware of and that we are happy to bear. #DesignYourWorkingLife - Digitization and flexibility characterize our modern working world. Design your everyday work in the way that suits you best: Whether in the office, remotely throughout Germany or from other EU countries. Want to travel longer? Then take a sabbatical and discover the possibilities of New Work with us.

UniCredit is built on Integrity, Ownership and Caring. Living these Values authentically means doing what is right for our colleagues, clients, and communities. We are a pan-European Commercial Bank with a unique service offering in Italy, Germany, Central and Eastern Europe. We serve over 15 million customers worldwide and our strength comes from the impact we can make on those people’s lives and on our environment.

Rooted in our company’s Purpose is helping our communities to progress, not only through our differentiated products and services, but also through our investments aimed at building a sustainable future for our communities and strengthening their financial well-being. Moreover we contribute to addressing the climate and environmental crisis by minimizing our carbon footprint and helping our customers and communities do the same.

Our colleagues are critical to the success of our Purpose. They are the driving force behind the impact we make in the communities we serve. When you join UniCredit, you become part of an international, inclusive and diverse community that leverages on “diversity of thought", regardless of gender identity, age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, ability or cultural background.

As you grow in our company, we back you up through a common Culture of learning and collaboration, benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.

Because we believe that the best way to make a difference in our client’s life is to make a difference in the life of our people.

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (NLP)
description:
**About the Role:**

We are seeking an experienced Senior Machine Learning Engineer with expertise in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and healthcare data to join our AI/Data Science team. This role is crucial in advancing our efforts to enhance Clinical Decision Support (CDS) and optimize lab testing through innovative Machine Learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies. 




The ideal candidate will have a robust background in ML, NLP, and AI, with extensive experience in handling complex medical datasets, including electronic health records (EHRs) and medical ontologies. The selected candidate will drive the development of NLP technology and the associated tech stack, ensuring alignment with our healthcare objectives. Additionally, the candidate should have strong experience with MLOps/DevOps practices, as they will serve as the primary contact for these topics within the team, supporting the infrastructure team to ensure seamless deployment and operationalization of ML models. The selected candidate will establish and manage collaborations with external service providers, such as LLM inference endpoints, to enhance our capabilities. They will also collaborate with colleagues on topics related to medical knowledge graphs and patient data. 




This is a hands-on, developer-facing role, requiring extensive software engineering skills in Python to develop and deploy production-quality code in a collaborative environment. 




**Key Responsibilities:**

* Lead the development and enhancement of NLP technologies and the tech stack, ensuring alignment with healthcare and AI/ML objectives. 

* Analyze and interpret complex medical datasets, including structured and unstructured data from scientific publications, EHRs, and medical ontologies, to extract meaningful insights. 

* Establish and manage collaborations with external service providers, such as LLM inference endpoints, to enhance our technological capabilities and service offerings. 

* Collaborate with team colleagues on topics related to medical knowledge graphs and patient data, ensuring a cohesive approach to integrating various data sources and technologies. 

* Develop high-quality, maintainable Python code, adhering to software engineering best practices. 

* Act as the primary liaison for MLOps/DevOps, collaborating with the infrastructure team to ensure smooth deployment, scaling, and monitoring of ML models. 

* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, data engineers, and healthcare professionals, to apply advanced data science techniques in clinical settings. 

* Implement robust monitoring, logging, and alerting solutions to ensure the reliability, scalability, and availability of data processing and ML services. 

* Stay updated with the latest advancements in NLP, Large Language Models (LLMs), medical data science, and ML, and integrate these into the company’s technology stack and practices. 




**Required Qualifications:**

* Advanced degree (Master's or Ph.D.) in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field. 

* Minimum of 5 years of experience in Data Science, Machine Learning, or Artificial Intelligence, with a significant focus on NLP and text analytics. 

* Proven experience in driving the development of NLP technologies and managing the associated tech stack in a professional setting. 

* Extensive software engineering skills, particularly in Python, with a track record of developing and deploying production-quality code. 

* Proficiency in Python, SQL, and NoSQL databases, with hands-on experience in cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure. 

* Demonstrated expertise in developing ML models for predictive analytics, particularly in the healthcare domain. 

* Experience with MLOps/DevOps practices, including the deployment and operationalization of ML models, CI/CD pipelines, and infrastructure collaboration. 

* Experience with Large Language Models (LLMs), including prompting and quantization techniques. 

* Strong collaborative skills with a proven ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams, including product managers, infrastructure teams, and stakeholders. 

* Experience in implementing monitoring, logging, and alerting solutions to ensure the reliability and availability of data processing and ML services. 

* Excellent problem-solving abilities and a proactive approach to addressing complex challenges. 

* English fluency required (B1 or above). 

* Willingness to work within Central European Time (CET) business hours. 




**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience in the healthcare industry, particularly within the U.S. market. 

* Familiarity with healthcare standards and protocols (e.g., HL7, FHIR). 

* Strong background in ML, NLP, and text analytics, with a focus on medical datasets, ontologies, and EHRs. 

* Experience with big data technologies and cloud computing platforms. 

* Experience with data curation and annotation processes, particularly in the context of healthcare datasets.

title: Computer Vision Engineer (m/f/d)
description:

This is an English-speaking role with a hybrid working model, allowing you to enjoy the flexibility of working both remotely and in their Berlin office.

Design, develop, and optimise computer vision algorithms for AR applications.
Implement and integrate machine learning models for object detection, tracking, and recognition.
Work with other team members to define project requirements and deliver innovative solutions.
Conduct research and keep updated with the latest advancements in Computer Vision and AR technologies.

Proven experience in Computer Vision within a professional environment.
Strong programming skills in languages with Python and/or C++
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, OpenCV).
Experience with AR development platforms and tools is a plus

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Flexible hybrid working model.
Opportunity to work on groundbreaking AR projects with leading companies.
Collaborative and inclusive work environment.
Professional development and growth opportunities.

title: Freelance Mathematics Expert - AI Tutor
description:
We are embarking on a large-scale project with a leading technology company to develop an AI system with a deep understanding of the natural sciences. Your contributions will help shape an AI that educates, inspires curiosity, and promotes a deeper understanding of abstract systems and their applications.

Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
A strong passion for writing, editing, and the formal science

Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge

Take part in part-time, remote, freelance projects that respect your primary professional or academic commitments
Try your hand at an AI project and enrich your portfolio with new experiences
Make a tangible impact on the quality of AI

title: System Engineer Simulation / Künstliche Intelligenz (KI) (d/f/m)
description:
Zur Verstärkung der Abteilung "Operationelle Analyse und Studien" in der Organisation "Studien und Simulation" suchen wir für Airbus Defence and Space in Friedrichshafen einen

System Engineer Simulation / Künstliche Intelligenz (KI) (d/f/m)

Wir entwickeln militärische Simulationsumgebungen für Studien und Forschungsprojekte, welche für Analysen und zum KI-Training verwendet werden. Mittels Machine Learning/Deep Learning Ansätzen entwickeln wir KI-Verfahren zur autonomen Planung und Entscheidungsfindung unter unsicheren Bedingungen und in komplexen operationellen, militärischen Situationen.

Wir implementieren und erproben modernste Deep Reinforcement-Learning Ansätze für die Nutzung im militärischen Umfeld, mit denen sich unsere KI-Anwendungen sicher, datensparsam und zuverlässig optimieren lassen. Die wegweisenden Ergebnisse publizieren wir auf internationalen Konferenzen (z.B. NATO-STO-Best-Paper-Award_2021).

Wir suchen einen "Software Entwickler Simulation / Künstliche Intelligenz (KI) (d/f/m)", der uns bei der Übertragung der Ergebnisse der akademischen Forschung auf reale Systeme unterstützt. Du arbeitest in unserer jungen und agilen Studienabteilung an interessanten Studien- und Forschungsprojekten der Bundeswehr, NATO, sowie Europäischen Union im Bereich Sicherheit und Verteidigung.

Respekt, Teamwork und Kreativität sind die Schlüsselwerte unserer Abteilung. Als Studienabteilung sind wir auch in Innovationsaktivitäten im Bereich Künstliche Intelligenz oder Quantencomputing involviert. Zusammen mit der Airbus Innovation Factory in Friedrichshafen findest du bei uns das richtige Umfeld, um deine innovativen Ideen voranzutreiben und in die Realität umzusetzen.



Deine Aufgaben und Verantwortlichkeiten


Technische Leitung in der Entwicklung und Erprobung von KI-Ansätzen zur autonomen Planung und Entscheidungsfindung im militärischen Umfeld

Verantwortung für die Umsetzung von mehreren Studien mit kleinen Studienteams in Zeit, Kosten und Qualität

Vorbereitung und Durchführung von Kundenpräsentationen und Besprechungen

Erstellung von Software Architekturen und sowie von MLOps getriebenen Entwicklung für KI Trainings auf modernen Container/Kubernetes Umgebungen und Verteilsystemen (z.B. Ray)

Führung des technischen Austauschs mit anderen Fachabteilungen und Projektpartnern (Industrie, wissenschaftliche Institute)

Implementieren und Optimieren verschiedener Deep Reinforcement Learning Verfahren im Zusammenspiel mit militärischen Simulationen (C++ oder Python)

Praxisnahe Umsetzung und Erprobung in Kooperation mit anderen Fachabteilungen sowie industriellen und wissenschaftlichen Partnern (Universitäten, Fraunhofer Gesellschaft,



Erforderliche Qualifikationen


Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium (Diplom/Master) oder Promotion der Informatik mit Vertiefung in Künstlicher Intelligenz (KI) und/oder Simulation

Du verfügst über sehr gute praktische Programmiererfahrung in Python und entsprechenden ML Bibliotheken (z.B. Tensorflow, PyTorch, Rlib/Ray)

Sehr gute Erfahrungen im Bereich Simulationsentwicklung / Game Engines mit Python und/oder C++ (oder vergleichbar) wären von Vorteil

Idealerweise, verfügst Du über gute praktische Erfahrungen im Software-Engineering (u.a. Erstellung von Software-Architekturen);
Sicherer Umgang mit CI/CD-Umgebungen wie z.B. GitHub/Gitlab, PyCharm, Visual Studio, etc. (idealerweise auf Windows und Linux)
Du hast solide Erfahrungen im Bereich des agilen technischen Führens von Projektteams; gute Kenntnisse im Umgang mit dem ATLASSIAN Toolstack (JIRA, Confluence) sind von Vorteil
Nationale und internationale Reisebereitschaft

Fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift.

Du besitzt eine selbstständige und verantwortungsvolle Arbeitsweise und bringst eine hohe Motivation und Teamfähigkeit mit. Du hast Freude daran Wissen zu teilen und Dir kontinuierlich neues Wissen anzueignen.

title: Research Associate (m/f/x)
description:
TUD Dresden University of Technology, as a University of Excellence, is one of the leading and most dynamic research institutions in the country. Founded in 1828, today it is a globally oriented, regionally anchored top university as it focuses on the grand challenges of the 21st century. It develops innovative solutions for the world's most pressing issues. In research and academic programs, the university unites the natural and engineering sciences with the humanities, social sciences and medicine. This wide range of disciplines is a special feature, facilitating interdisciplinarity and transfer of science to society. As a modern employer, it offers attractive working conditions to all employees in teaching, research, technology and administration. The goal is to promote and develop their individual abilities while empowering everyone to reach their full potential. TUD embodies a university culture that is characterized by cosmopolitanism, mutual appreciation, thriving innovation and active participation. For TUD diversity is an essential feature and a quality criterion of an excellent university. Accordingly, we welcome all applicants who would like to commit themselves, their achievements and productivity to the success of the whole institution.

At the Faculty of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Institute of Communication Technology, the Vodafone Chair of Mobile Communications Systems offers a position as

Research Associate (m/f/x)

(subject to personal qualification employees are remunerated according to salary group E 13 TV-L)

starting at the earliest possible date. The position is limited to 18 months with the option of extension. The period of employment is governed by the Fixed Term Research Contracts Act (Wissenschaftszeitvertragsgesetz - WissZeitVG). The position offers the chance to obtain further academic qualification.

The Vodafone Chair for Mobile Communications Systems offers the opportunity to help shape the development of future mobile communication systems in a prosperous and dynamic environment, to gain valuable project experience and to establish and deepen contacts with innovative companies. Further information on the Vodafone Chair can be found at https://mns.ifn.et.tu-dresden.de/. The research at the Vodafone Chair runs within the scope of DFG, EU and BMBF projects as well as within the framework of an ERC Synergy Grant.

Tasks: you will conduct research in the field of wireless communications technology on one of the following topics:


Development and evaluation of resilient wireless systems for
spectrum sensing, channel modeling, radio resource management, anti-jamming
machine learning and digital twinning
applications in industry and medicine
Transmission and signal processing techniques for joint communication and sensing, including waveform and frame design, parameter estimation algorithms, and applications of sensing such as localization.
Beamforming architectures and techniques for massive ultrawideband MIMO
Gearbox PHY concept: design of multi-gear radio interface, and optimization of the operation using AI/ML techniques for gear switching and dynamic reconfiguration
Physical layer design for ultra-energy-efficient wireless spike-based sensor node communication, including optimized spike modulation, stochastic modeling of a spike-based signal processing chain, and task-based communication.
Algorithm design for innovative quasi-optical terabit/sec wireless communications systems with energy-efficient oversampled 1-bit quantization: digital baseband design including the study of optimal modulation, channel estimation, and receiver synchronization algorithms
Field testing with our own 5G SA Campus Networks including ORAN
Mobile network measurements with best-in-class equipment and process automation
Airborne RF measurements using 5G connected drones
Communications and control co-design for wireless-networked control systems
Reduction of latency requirements for cyber-physical systems using model-based prediction and estimation
Learning for dynamical systems and control using data-driven/ML techniques

All tasks are carried out in cooperation with partners from industry and science. The field of activity also includes the supervision of student work related to the research topics. The results of the work are to be published at international conferences and in distinguished journals.

Requirements: an above-average university degree in the field of computer science, electrical engineering, communications engineering or information systems engineering; profound knowledge of wireless communications, communications engineering and digital signal processing; independent, goal- and solution-oriented approach; integrative and cooperative behavior with very good communication and social skills; confident command of written and spoken English.

TUD strives to employ more women in academia and research. We therefore expressly encourage women to apply. The University is a certified family-friendly university and offers a Dual Career Service. We welcome applications from candidates with disabilities. If multiple candidates prove to be equally qualified, those with disabilities or with equivalent status pursuant to the German Social Code IX (SGB IX) will receive priority for employment.

Please submit your detailed application with the usual documents by August 30, 2024 (stamped arrival date of the university central mail service of TUD applies) stating the Job-ID w24-280 to jobs@ifn.et.tu-dresden.de (Please note: We are currently not able to receive electronically signed and encrypted data) or to: TU Dresden, Fakultät Elektrotechnik und Informationstechnik, Institut für Nachrichtentechnik, Vodafone Stiftungsprofessur für Mobile Nachrichtensysteme, Herrn Prof. Gerhard Fettweis, Helmholtzstr. 10, 01069 Dresden, Germany. Please submit copies only, as your application will not be returned to you. Expenses incurred in attending interviews cannot be reimbursed.

Reference to data protection: Your data protection rights, the purpose for which your data will be processed, as well as further information about data protection is available to you on the website: https://tu-dresden.de/karriere/datenschutzhinweis.
Show more

title: Robotics Software Engineer (w/m/d)
description:
Über uns: Wir sind ein Startup an der Spitze der landwirtschaftlichen Innovation, das sich auf die Entwicklung von Ernterobotern für Erdbeeren spezialisiert hat. Unser Ziel ist es, die Erdbeerernte zu revolutionieren und sie effizienter, nachhaltiger und kostengünstiger zu machen.

Hast du eine Leidenschaft für Softwareentwicklung und Expertise in Robotik und Pfadplanung? Bist du bereit, einen Beitrag zu einem bahnbrechenden Startup zu leisten, das die Agrarindustrie verändert? Suche nicht weiter! Wir haben eine unglaubliche Chance, die auf dich wartet!

Aufgaben

Deine Rolle:

Wir verwenden einen 7-Achsroboterarm, auf einer mobilen Plattform, zusammen mit mehreren Kameras, um Erdbeeren zu pflücken. Unsere Computer-Vision-Algorithmen erfassen die gesamte Umgebung des Roboters. Du wirst diese dynamischen Kollisionsobjekte und Ziele als Randbedingungen für die Pfadplanung und den Steuerungsalgorithmus verwenden, um unsere Roboterarme zu steuern. Die low-level Steuerung des Roboterarms, unsere custom Bildverarbeitung und unsere vorhandenen Lösungen zur Pfadplanung und Regelung sind leistungsstarke Werkzeuge, die dir Gestaltungsfreiheit geben. Du wirst mit modernster Technologie an der Spitze der Robotik arbeiten, um unsere Roboter schneller, intelligenter und lernfähiger zu machen.

Aufgabenprofil:


Pfad- und Trajektorienplanung sowie Regelung von 7-Achsrobotern
Weiterentwicklung und Test von Schnittstellen zum Computer Vision System
Weiterentwicklung und Pflege der Schnittstelle zum Roboterarm
Rapid Prototyping deiner Entwürfe und Ideen in der Simulation und auf realer Hardware



Abhängig von deinen Fähigkeiten und Interessen:


Entwicklung und Erprobung von selbstlernenden Pfadplanern und Regelungsverfahren
Entwicklung und Erprobung neuer Ansätze zur vision-based Robotersteuerung



Qualifikation

Qualifikationen:


Abgeschlossenes Informatik- oder Robotikstudium (oder vergleichbarer Studiengang)
Erfahrung mit ROS und Paketen zur Pfadplanung und Regelung (MoveIt!, OMPL, ros control, ...)
Kenntnisse in C++ und Python
Praktische Erfahrung mit Robotersteuerung, Pfadplanung und 3D-Vision-Systemen
Teamgeist
Leidenschaft für die Entwicklung von innovativen Lösungen
Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse



Benefits

Was wir bieten:


Hoch motiviertes und talentiertes Team mit einer Leidenschaft für innovative Ideen
Leiste einen signifikationen Beitrag durch deine eigenen Ideen und Konzepte
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und die Möglichkeit, von zu Hause aus zu arbeiten
30 Tage Urlaub & Hansefit-Mitgliedschaft
Tolle Teamevents, jährliches Offsite und gemeinsame Mittagessen



Du liebst es, technische Herausforderungen zu lösen, begeisterst dich für Robotik und Machine Learning und möchtest einen transformativen Wandel vorantreiben?

Dann bewirb dich jetzt!
Show more

title: Robotics Engineer - Vision Language Action Model
description:
sensmore is a pioneering AI software automation company, focused on developing state-of-the-art AI solutions for heavy machinery in extreme conditions.

We specialize in AI-powered technologies that enhance understanding and operational intelligence in harsh environments, enabling advanced driver assistance and autonomous functions for industries like mining, construction, and agriculture.

Join us and play a pivotal role in transforming the automation landscape in heavy industries.

Role Overview:

We are looking for a skilled Robotics Engineer specialized in Vision Language Action Models to join our team. The ideal candidate will possess expertise in integrating vision, language understanding, and action generation to develop AI systems that enhance robotic interaction and autonomy in complex environments.

Key Responsibilities:


Design and develop AI systems that combine vision, language, and motor control to improve the autonomy of robotic platforms.
Work on the implementation of Vision-Language Action Models that allow robots to perform tasks based on verbal and visual cues.
Test and refine models under real-world conditions to ensure reliability and effectiveness.
Collaborate with software engineers and roboticists to integrate these systems into larger automation solutions.
Contribute across all phases of the development lifecycle, from initial research to deployment and ongoing optimization.


Required Qualifications:


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Robotics, AI, Computer Science, or a related field.
Strong programming skills in Python and familiarity with C++.
Proven expertise in machine learning, especially in vision-language models and robotic control systems.
Experience with vision and language processing frameworks such as OpenCV and transformers.
Ability to tackle complex, interdisciplinary technology challenges.


Preferred Skills:


Practical experience with implementing Vision-Language Action Models in robotic systems.
Familiarity with sensor fusion techniques and real-time system integration.
Experience with robotics simulation and testing frameworks.
Publication or contribution to relevant AI or robotics conferences or journals.


What We Offer:


A dynamic startup environment where you can make a substantial impact.
Competitive salary with equity options.
Flexible hours and hybrid working arrangements to balance personal and professional life.
A diverse, innovative team committed to technological excellence and groundbreaking solutions.
Extensive opportunities for professional development in a fast-growing technology company.


Benefits:


Attractive compensation package and stock options.
Beverages on-site and regular social events.
Engage with top-tier researchers, engineers, and thought leaders.
Influence the future of robotic technologies and tackle significant technological challenges.
Assistance with relocation to Berlin.
Flexible schedules emphasizing quality and productivity.


About Us:

sensmore is comprised of a diverse group of individuals whose varied backgrounds and perspectives fuel our innovation. We are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. Although we support remote work, our culture thrives on in-person interactions, which we find essential for tackling the complex problems we face. Our policy requires team members to work onsite at least 50% of the time.

title: Robotics Engineer - AI (end-to-end Controls)

sensmore is a pioneering AI software automation company, focused on developing state-of-the-art AI solutions for heavy machinery in extreme conditions.

We are looking for a skilled Robotics Engineer specialized in AI-driven end-to-end manipulation to enhance our team. The successful candidate will possess a strong background in robotics, AI, and control systems, with a dedicated focus on solving intricate problems related to robotic handling and manipulation. Your role will involve designing and developing advanced manipulation systems that enable robots to interact effectively and safely with their environments.

Design, develop, and optimize AI algorithms for robotic manipulation tasks.
Implement robust manipulation systems that integrate with existing robotic platforms.
Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of manipulation systems into broader robotic applications.
Engage in the full software development lifecycle, from concept through design, deployment, and ongoing improvement.

Strong programming skills in Python and C++.
Solid grounding in robotics, AI, and control systems.
Proven experience in robotic manipulation and end-to-end handling solutions.
Knowledge of machine learning and adaptive control strategies.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.

Practical experience with tactile sensing and force control.
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Experience with real-world robotic systems in industrial applications.
Exposure to collaborative robot systems and safety protocols in robotics.
A portfolio demonstrating hands-on experience in robotics projects.


What We Offer:


A dynamic startup environment where you can make a substantial impact.
Competitive salary with equity options.

Flexible schedules emphasizing quality and productivity.


About Us:

sensmore is comprised of a diverse group of individuals whose varied backgrounds and perspectives fuel our innovation. We are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. Although we support remote work, our culture thrives on in-person interactions, which we find essential for tackling the complex problems we face. Our policy requires team members to work onsite at least 50% of the time.
Show more

title: Head of Artificial Intelligence
description:
Job Title: Head of AI




Location: Germany (Remote/Hybrid Options Available)




About Us: We are an innovative Open AI company at the forefront of artificial intelligence and machine learning technology. Our mission is to democratize AI, making it accessible, safe, and beneficial for all. Based in Germany, we thrive on cutting-edge research, ethical AI practices, and collaborative innovation.




Role Overview: We are seeking a visionary Head of AI to lead our AI strategy and research initiatives. This role involves overseeing a team of talented researchers and engineers working on groundbreaking projects that push the boundaries of AI technology. Your expertise will guide our development efforts, ensuring our AI solutions are robust, scalable, and ethically sound.




Key Responsibilities:

Lead and mentor a team of AI researchers and engineers.
Develop and implement AI strategies aligned with company goals.
Drive research and development of innovative AI models and applications.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI solutions.
Ensure ethical AI practices and compliance with industry standards.
Represent the company in academic and industry forums.




Qualifications:

PhD or Master’s degree in Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Proven experience in leading AI teams and projects.
Strong background in AI/ML algorithms, neural networks, and data science.
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
Passion for ethical AI and its societal impact.




Why Join Us:

Be a part of a pioneering AI company with a strong ethical foundation.
Work in a dynamic and collaborative environment.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Flexible working arrangements.

Show more

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM


Zalando Marketing Service (ZMS) stands for a new era of marketing in e-commerce. The company helps partners to shape love brands, create strong customer relationships, and accelerate their business, by integrating data-infused and inspirational marketing. ZMS enables fashion, beauty and lifestyle partners to engage with ~50 million active customers across 25 European markets on Zalando and beyond, and provides access to exclusive fashion and lifestyle audiences. Based on deep customer insights, smart marketing tools, assortment and content creation expertise across >50K campaigns, ZMS drives the marketing and sales impact of its partners seamlessly along the path to purchase, from brand awareness, to consideration and conversion.

We are ambitious and committed to be the starting point of fashion for our customers and partners; therefore we are re-founding and scaling our Applied Science and Engineering backbone for Ads Personalization working backwards from user, content and context understanding.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in ZMS, you will work with talented scientists and engineers to build our real-time recommendation for our Ad Tech platform which includes Sponsored Product and Campaign advertisements. You will be responsible for building and scaling a new generation of machine learning products in the new and evolving field of Machine Learning Ops (ML Ops) in close collaboration with our Applied Scientists and Engineers.

This position is a unique opportunity to have visible impact, and connect with exceptional talents from many different backgrounds you will be part of a talented cross-functional team made up of Applied Scientists, Data Engineers and Software Engineers. Together, and with the support of Product Managers and Designers, you create, design and deliver new features to serve our customers and partners needs.


WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)




You play a key role in the design, architecture and development of end to end engineering solutions with full operational responsibilities on Cloud (AWS, Kubernetes) to allow our builders define, execute, and monitor Machine Learning Workflows
Collaborate with the department’s Applied Scientists to optimise the training time and serving latencies of our ML recommendation models.
Take ownership of the operational excellence of our AI systems design the architecture, looking for improvements in monitoring and scale ML algorithms
You enjoy communicating and collaborating with customers, product managers and engineering peers.




WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF




A degree in Computer Science, or related field of study, or equivalent practical experience in writing clean, easy to change and testable code
Strong programming skills with Java or Scala and you have experience working with Python or are willing to learn Python
Knowledge in Agile Software Development, CI / CD, monitoring and scalability.
You hold experience in building and operating REST APIs




OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer. Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with 60% remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available




INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. This vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.



do.BETTER - Our Diversity & Inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy
Our Employee Resource Groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups
Show more

title: Research Associate (m/f/x)
description:
TUD Dresden University of Technology, as a University of Excellence, is one of the leading and most dynamic research institutions in the country. Founded in 1828, today it is a globally oriented, regionally anchored top university as it focuses on the grand challenges of the 21st century. It develops innovative solutions for the world's most pressing issues. In research and academic programs, the university unites the natural and engineering sciences with the humanities, social sciences and medicine. This wide range of disciplines is a special feature, facilitating interdisciplinarity and transfer of science to society. As a modern employer, it offers attractive working conditions to all employees in teaching, research, technology and administration. The goal is to promote and develop their individual abilities while empowering everyone to reach their full potential. TUD embodies a university culture that is characterized by cosmopolitanism, mutual appreciation, thriving innovation and active participation. For TUD diversity is an essential feature and a quality criterion of an excellent university. Accordingly, we welcome all applicants who would like to commit themselves, their achievements and productivity to the success of the whole institution.

At the Faculty of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Institute of Communication Technology, the Vodafone Chair of Mobile Communications Systems offers a position as

Research Associate (m/f/x)

(subject to personal qualification employees are remunerated according to salary group E 13 TV-L)

starting at the earliest possible date. The position is limited to 18 months with the option of extension. The period of employment is governed by the Fixed Term Research Contracts Act (Wissenschaftszeitvertragsgesetz - WissZeitVG). The position offers the chance to obtain further academic qualification.

The Vodafone Chair for Mobile Communications Systems offers the opportunity to help shape the development of future mobile communication systems in a prosperous and dynamic environment, to gain valuable project experience and to establish and deepen contacts with innovative companies. Further information on the Vodafone Chair can be found at https://mns.ifn.et.tu-dresden.de/. The research at the Vodafone Chair runs within the scope of DFG, EU and BMBF projects as well as within the framework of an ERC Synergy Grant.

Tasks: you will conduct research in the field of wireless communications technology on one of the following topics:


Development and evaluation of resilient wireless systems for
spectrum sensing, channel modeling, radio resource management, anti-jamming
machine learning and digital twinning
applications in industry and medicine
Transmission and signal processing techniques for joint communication and sensing, including waveform and frame design, parameter estimation algorithms, and applications of sensing such as localization.
Beamforming architectures and techniques for massive ultrawideband MIMO
Gearbox PHY concept: design of multi-gear radio interface, and optimization of the operation using AI/ML techniques for gear switching and dynamic reconfiguration
Physical layer design for ultra-energy-efficient wireless spike-based sensor node communication, including optimized spike modulation, stochastic modeling of a spike-based signal processing chain, and task-based communication.
Algorithm design for innovative quasi-optical terabit/sec wireless communications systems with energy-efficient oversampled 1-bit quantization: digital baseband design including the study of optimal modulation, channel estimation, and receiver synchronization algorithms
Field testing with our own 5G SA Campus Networks including ORAN
Mobile network measurements with best-in-class equipment and process automation
Airborne RF measurements using 5G connected drones
Communications and control co-design for wireless-networked control systems
Reduction of latency requirements for cyber-physical systems using model-based prediction and estimation
Learning for dynamical systems and control using data-driven/ML techniques

All tasks are carried out in cooperation with partners from industry and science. The field of activity also includes the supervision of student work related to the research topics. The results of the work are to be published at international conferences and in distinguished journals.

Requirements: an above-average university degree in the field of computer science, electrical engineering, communications engineering or information systems engineering; profound knowledge of wireless communications, communications engineering and digital signal processing; independent, goal- and solution-oriented approach; integrative and cooperative behavior with very good communication and social skills; confident command of written and spoken English.

TUD strives to employ more women in academia and research. We therefore expressly encourage women to apply. The University is a certified family-friendly university and offers a Dual Career Service. We welcome applications from candidates with disabilities. If multiple candidates prove to be equally qualified, those with disabilities or with equivalent status pursuant to the German Social Code IX (SGB IX) will receive priority for employment.

Please submit your detailed application with the usual documents by August 30, 2024 (stamped arrival date of the university central mail service of TUD applies) stating the Job-ID w24-280 to jobs@ifn.et.tu-dresden.de (Please note: We are currently not able to receive electronically signed and encrypted data) or to: TU Dresden, Fakultät Elektrotechnik und Informationstechnik, Institut für Nachrichtentechnik, Vodafone Stiftungsprofessur für Mobile Nachrichtensysteme, Herrn Prof. Gerhard Fettweis, Helmholtzstr. 10, 01069 Dresden, Germany. Please submit copies only, as your application will not be returned to you. Expenses incurred in attending interviews cannot be reimbursed.

Reference to data protection: Your data protection rights, the purpose for which your data will be processed, as well as further information about data protection is available to you on the website: https://tu-dresden.de/karriere/datenschutzhinweis.
Show more

title: Applied Machine Learning / LLM Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
About Recyda

At Recyda, we thrive to revolutionise the world of packaging sustainability and circular economy. We have embarked on a mission to become the undisputed category winner for digital packaging sustainability management. With our innovative software-as-a-service solution, we are transforming the way companies achieve their sustainability goals.

With our technology, we aim to solve every headache associated with the intricate web of sustainability requirements in each market. Our all-encompassing platform streamlines the sustainability journey - from tracking and reporting to compliance and optimisation. Our software solution already serves as a game-changer to global companies like Beiersdorf and Kao.




The stage is set, and the excitement is contagious. We recently received funding from top tier investors like Speedinvest, Auxxo Female Catalyst Fund and Futury Capital as well as founders of TWAICE, Planetly and one • fıve. The countdown to a sustainable future begins now!




The Role

As an Applied LLM & Machine Learning Engineer at Recyda, you'll be responsible for integrating advanced Machine Learning and Large Language Models (LLMs) techniques into our packaging sustainability management platform. Your work will directly impact how some of the largest enterprise clients in the world analyze, report, and improve their packaging sustainability efforts.




Your Tasks

Own initiatives to develop and implement ML & LLM solutions to automate and enhance packaging analysis for sustainability metrics (incl. e.g. recyclability, producer responsibility, regulations, etc.)
Design and build intelligent systems to extract insights from vast amounts of packaging and regulation data
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for AI-driven improvements in our platform
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in LLMs, ML, and AI, and propose innovative applications for our platform




Skills and Experience

Professional Experience:

5+ years of experience in general software development, with a current focus on ML and AI applications. Preferably a “full-stack” mindset and experience with Node.js and TypeScript-based applications.
Strong programming skills in relevant languages and familiarity with ML frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Experience working with LLMs and natural language processing techniques
Solid understanding of data structures, algorithms, and software design principles
Excellent problem-solving skills and work ethic to thrive in a fast-paced startup environment
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) and containerization technologies is a plus
Interest in sustainability and circular economy concepts is of course a big plus

Soft Skills:

Flexibility and reliability are important in your work environment
Strong goal-orientation with a high degree of initiative and motivation
Proficient English skills
Open to work in an agile, multi-cultural team and strive for continuous learning and improvement




Why you should join Recyda

Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies that impact the sustainability of packaging across the whole value chain
A fast-paced VC-funded startup environment with a collaborative and diverse team
Remote work possible
Professional development and learning opportunities
Chance to make a real impact on global packaging sustainability efforts




If you're passionate about using AI to drive sustainability and want to be at the forefront of packaging innovation, we want to hear from you!

Show more

title: Chief Product Officer (AI)
description:
Job Description: Chief Product Officer (CPO) with AI Experience




Title: Chief Product Officer (CPO)




Location: Remote in Germany




Position Overview: As the CPO, you'll define and execute our product vision and roadmap, leading a talented team to create innovative, AI-driven products that exceed customer expectations.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and communicate a compelling AI-driven product vision and strategy.
Lead the end-to-end product lifecycle, ensuring alignment with business goals.
Collaborate with engineering, data science, marketing, and sales teams.
Drive AI adoption in product development to enhance capabilities and user experiences.
Conduct market research to identify trends and adjust strategy accordingly.
Define and track key performance metrics for data-driven decision-making.
Foster a culture of innovation and collaboration within the product team.




Qualifications:

Proven experience as a CPO or similar role, focusing on AI-driven products.
Strong AI, machine learning, and data science background.
Successful track record in leading and scaling product teams.
Excellent strategic thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Experience in [specific industry or sector] is a plus.
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field; advanced degree preferred.




What We Offer:

Competitive salary and equity package.
Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance.
Flexible work environment with remote options.
Professional development and career growth opportunities.
Dynamic, collaborative, and innovative work culture.

title: Research Associate (m/f/x)
description:
TUD Dresden University of Technology, as a University of Excellence, is one of the leading and most dynamic research institutions in the country. Founded in 1828, today it is a globally oriented, regionally anchored top university as it focuses on the grand challenges of the 21st century. It develops innovative solutions for the world's most pressing issues. In research and academic programs, the university unites the natural and engineering sciences with the humanities, social sciences and medicine. This wide range of disciplines is a special feature, facilitating interdisciplinarity and transfer of science to society. As a modern employer, it offers attractive working conditions to all employees in teaching, research, technology and administration. The goal is to promote and develop their individual abilities while empowering everyone to reach their full potential. TUD embodies a university culture that is characterized by cosmopolitanism, mutual appreciation, thriving innovation and active participation. For TUD diversity is an essential feature and a quality criterion of an excellent university. Accordingly, we welcome all applicants who would like to commit themselves, their achievements and productivity to the success of the whole institution.

At the Faculty of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Institute of Communication Technology, the Vodafone Chair of Mobile Communications Systems offers a position as

Research Associate (m/f/x)

(subject to personal qualification employees are remunerated according to salary group E 13 TV-L)

starting at the earliest possible date. The position is limited to 18 months with the option of extension. The period of employment is governed by the Fixed Term Research Contracts Act (Wissenschaftszeitvertragsgesetz - WissZeitVG). The position offers the chance to obtain further academic qualification.

The Vodafone Chair for Mobile Communications Systems offers the opportunity to help shape the development of future mobile communication systems in a prosperous and dynamic environment, to gain valuable project experience and to establish and deepen contacts with innovative companies. Further information on the Vodafone Chair can be found at https://mns.ifn.et.tu-dresden.de/. The research at the Vodafone Chair runs within the scope of DFG, EU and BMBF projects as well as within the framework of an ERC Synergy Grant.

Tasks: you will conduct research in the field of wireless communications technology on one of the following topics:


Development and evaluation of resilient wireless systems for
spectrum sensing, channel modeling, radio resource management, anti-jamming
machine learning and digital twinning
applications in industry and medicine
Transmission and signal processing techniques for joint communication and sensing, including waveform and frame design, parameter estimation algorithms, and applications of sensing such as localization.
Beamforming architectures and techniques for massive ultrawideband MIMO
Gearbox PHY concept: design of multi-gear radio interface, and optimization of the operation using AI/ML techniques for gear switching and dynamic reconfiguration
Physical layer design for ultra-energy-efficient wireless spike-based sensor node communication, including optimized spike modulation, stochastic modeling of a spike-based signal processing chain, and task-based communication.
Algorithm design for innovative quasi-optical terabit/sec wireless communications systems with energy-efficient oversampled 1-bit quantization: digital baseband design including the study of optimal modulation, channel estimation, and receiver synchronization algorithms
Field testing with our own 5G SA Campus Networks including ORAN
Mobile network measurements with best-in-class equipment and process automation
Airborne RF measurements using 5G connected drones
Communications and control co-design for wireless-networked control systems
Reduction of latency requirements for cyber-physical systems using model-based prediction and estimation
Learning for dynamical systems and control using data-driven/ML techniques

All tasks are carried out in cooperation with partners from industry and science. The field of activity also includes the supervision of student work related to the research topics. The results of the work are to be published at international conferences and in distinguished journals.

Requirements: an above-average university degree in the field of computer science, electrical engineering, communications engineering or information systems engineering; profound knowledge of wireless communications, communications engineering and digital signal processing; independent, goal- and solution-oriented approach; integrative and cooperative behavior with very good communication and social skills; confident command of written and spoken English.

TUD strives to employ more women in academia and research. We therefore expressly encourage women to apply. The University is a certified family-friendly university and offers a Dual Career Service. We welcome applications from candidates with disabilities. If multiple candidates prove to be equally qualified, those with disabilities or with equivalent status pursuant to the German Social Code IX (SGB IX) will receive priority for employment.

Please submit your detailed application with the usual documents by August 30, 2024 (stamped arrival date of the university central mail service of TUD applies) stating the Job-ID w24-280 to jobs@ifn.et.tu-dresden.de (Please note: We are currently not able to receive electronically signed and encrypted data) or to: TU Dresden, Fakultät Elektrotechnik und Informationstechnik, Institut für Nachrichtentechnik, Vodafone Stiftungsprofessur für Mobile Nachrichtensysteme, Herrn Prof. Gerhard Fettweis, Helmholtzstr. 10, 01069 Dresden, Germany. Please submit copies only, as your application will not be returned to you. Expenses incurred in attending interviews cannot be reimbursed.

Reference to data protection: Your data protection rights, the purpose for which your data will be processed, as well as further information about data protection is available to you on the website: https://tu-dresden.de/karriere/datenschutzhinweis.
Show more

title: AI Research Scientist/Engineer (f/m/d)
description:
Job Description

The mission of Intel Labs is to drive technology leadership for Intel. This includes conceiving, researching, prototyping, and coordinating with academic/external partners and Intel business groups to deliver technology innovation for future industry needs. This is a full time position with the Emerging Systems Lab at Intel Labs. The Emerging Systems Lab is driving exciting research to identify innovative technologies and capabilities for future of visual-AI systems especially, neural rendering and neural codecs. We focus on innovating on HW and SW technologies that will transform the visual computing experience, and edge/cloud systems. Our team is looking for a highly motivated senior researcher with a strong graphics and media processing background.

The candidate will be responsible for conceiving ideas, researching, prototyping, collaborating with external partners (aceramic, government) to drive technology innovation.


This requires a deep understanding of state-of-the-art techniques in real-time rendering, media codecs, neural techniques for rendering and media processing, a decent understanding of distributed computing, optimization of algorithms, and benchmarking, along with a computer architecture.
The candidate must have strong research discipline, hands on prototyping skills, and closely work with partners to drive research agenda.
The candidate is expected to maintain substantial knowledge of state-of-the-art principles and theories and contribute regularly to scientific literature and the research community-at-large and may participate in the development of Intellectual Property.
The ideal candidate should exhibit behavioral traits that indicate excellent interpersonal and communications skills in a cross-functional setting, and exceptional team player.
Self-Driven, demonstrating attention to detail and working in a fast-moving environment.
Proven track record of taking initiative and driving projects to completion and results orientation.


Qualifications


Experienced PhD+5 years in computer vision, computer graphics, machine learning, or a related field
Solid foundation in 3D geometry, deep learning, hands on experience with AI frameworks (e.g., PyTorch)
Experience in neural rendering, codecs, and 3D graphics
Strong publication record at top conferences such as NeurIPS, CVPR, SIGGRAPH, ECCV, ICCV, etc.
Ability to drive early-stage research projects with risks and ambiguity
Experience of leading externally (e.g., EU) funded grants


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with distributed computing, optimization of algorithms, and benchmarking, along with a computer architecture.
Experience with Modern Gaming Engines (e.g., Unity, Unreal Engine) and/or graphics applications/pipelines.


Inside this Business Group

Intel Labs is the company's world-class, industry leading research organization, responsible for driving Intel's technology pipeline and creating new opportunities. The mission of Intel Labs is to deliver breakthrough technologies to fuel Intel's growth. This includes identifying and exploring compelling new technologies and high risk opportunities ahead of business unit investment and demonstrating first-to-market technologies and innovative new usages for computing technology. Intel Labs engages the leading thinkers in academia and industry in addition to partnering closely with Intel business units.

Other Locations

DE, Karlsruhe

Posting Statement

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.

Benefits

We offer a total compensation package that ranks among the best in the industry. It consists of competitive pay, stock, bonuses, as well as, benefit programs which include health, retirement, and vacation. Find more information about all of our Amazing Benefits here.

Working Model

This role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site. In certain circumstances the work model may change to accommodate business needs.
